title: Experienced Product Designer
description:
For over 30 years, Wisentic has helped insurers work smarter through automation and innovation. Today, we’re one of the most trusted insurtech companies in the Nordics, using our SaaS products to simplify complexity, accelerate efficiency, and help insurers achieve their goals faster. Our teams are small, empowered, and focused on delivering real value to our customers - not just shipping features.

**The role**
------------


We’re looking for an **experienced** Product Designer who’s passionate about solving complex problems for professional users. You’ll be part of a cross-functional product trio, working closely with a Product Manager and Tech Lead to deeply understand customer needs, prototype and test solutions, and guide the product experience from concept to delivery. You will be a part of discovering and delivering solutions that are valuable, usable, feasible, and viable.


You’ll own the end-to-end user experience, from discovery and research to high-fidelity design, in a product area that’s central to our strategy and growth.

### **What you'll do**

* Lead user research, discovery interviews, and usability testing to uncover real customer problems.
* Translate insights into clear concepts, prototypes, and elegant design solutions.
* Contribute to and evolve our design system to ensure consistency and scalability.
* Partner with engineers to ensure design intent is realized in production.
* Champion user-centered design practices across the company.
* Help shape a culture of continuous learning, experimentation, and outcome-driven work.

### **Who we think you are**

* Experienced UX/Product Designer (6+ years) working on B2B SaaS products, ideally complex data or workflow-heavy tools.
* Comfortable balancing user needs, business goals, and technical feasibility.
* Familiar with agile and modern product discovery practices.
* Skilled in research, interaction design, and visual design (you can take a problem from ambiguity to implementation).
* Curious, collaborative, and motivated by making a real impact for users.
* Ideally hold an engineering or technical degree - you understand how products are built and can collaborate deeply with developers.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.

### **Why join us?**


We are a mission-driven company where your ideas have real impact. You’ll be part of a small, empowered product team - not a feature factory. Work closely with talented peers who value trust, autonomy, and craftsmanship, all in a hybrid setup at the heart of Stockholm.


Excited by what you’ve read? We’d love to hear from you! Send us your portfolio and a short note about a product you’ve helped shape - what was the problem, and how did your work make a difference?

title: Engine Systems & Tools Designer
description:
Are you passionate about designing the systems and tools that power game creation?  

  

Do you enjoy shaping workflows that make development smoother and more intuitive for artists, programmers, and designers?


Join our Engine & Tools team as an **Engine Systems & Tools Designer**, and help us bridge the gap between the engine development team and our users.


At Paradox, we are a vibrant mix of game developers and publishers, known worldwide for our strategy games. We're passionate about our gamers, with an active player base of over five million each month across the globe. We bring our games to life, creating immersive experiences for our ever-growing community.

### **What You’ll Do..**


As an **Engine Systems & Tools Designer**, you’ll design and improve systems, tools, and workflows that support developers across multiple projects. You’ll work closely with programmers, technical leads, and other disciplines to ensure that our internal tools are intuitive, scalable, and tailored for building our Grand Strategy Games. Your work will directly impact how efficiently our teams create content and build our games.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Design workflows, tools, and systems for content creation within the Engine & Tools team.
  
* Act as a central contact for understanding and shaping tools and requirements within the engine development team.
  
* Collaborate with programmers and stakeholders to ensure that tools align with both technical feasibility and creative needs.
  
* Influence tool development based on current usage, priorities, and long-term goals.
  
* Identify opportunities for shared technology and cross-project workflows.

### **What We’re Looking For**

* 3+ Years experience in UX or workflow design—preferably within game development tools and workflows.
  
* Strong understanding of the needs of technical and creative users (artists, designers, programmers).
  
* Proficiency in design and prototyping tools such as Figma, Adobe XD, or other flowcharting software.
  
* Familiarity with game development engines and tools (Unreal, Unity, or proprietary equivalents).
  
* Good interpersonal skills for working closely with programmers and other disciplines.
  
* Comfortable communicating in English, both written and spoken.

### **Good to have skills**

* Experience in C++ and Python to easier communicate with our programmers.

Working at Paradox means being part of a team that values creativity and quality, where you can make a difference and shape the world of strategy gaming. We embrace our nerdy culture, regularly interact with our fans through forums and events, and end each Friday with a social hour to unwind and connect.


If you're ready to take ownership of your work and grow as a game developer, we'd love to hear from you. Apply now and embark on an exciting journey with Paradox and the Engine & Tools team!

title: Junior Graphic Designer and Digital Communication Consultant
description:
**MSF Sweden Innovation Unit:** Junior Graphic Designer and Digital Communication Consultant


MSF SIU are looking for a junior graphic designer with digital communication knowledge to join the team in accelerating humanitarian health innovation and improving access to quality healthcare.


* Location: Flexible (time zone CET +2/-2)
* Duration: Part-time 60%, 3-months contract, with potential for extension
* Potential start date: 1 February 2026
* Reports to: Head of MSF Sweden Innovation Unit

**Background**


Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) is an international, independent, medical humanitarian organisation that delivers emergency aid to people affected by armed conflict, epidemics, natural disasters, and exclusion from healthcare. These programmes are run through five operational directorates (ODs). The Inclusive Innovation Partnership (made up of The Manson Unit in MSF UK and the Sweden Innovation Unit (SIU) in MSF Sweden) supports MSF work in-country through innovation and research projects with the aim to improve the quality in MSF operations. The Inclusive Innovation Partnership supports MSF staff to explore, develop and test innovative new approaches to challenges in our projects, to ultimately give people better access to medical care.


**Role overview**


The MSF SIU is looking for a JuniorGraphic Designer to develop and deliver visual design and communication material supporting the MSF SIU operations and Inclusive Innovation projects. Key responsibilities and deliverables associated with this role include:


**Graphic design**


* Develop and maintain new and existing branded materials that align with the brand guidelines for MSF SIU, the MSF Inclusive Innovation partnership, and the broader international MSF movement.
* Design and layout reports, presentations, funding proposals, workshop materials, and other related documents.
* Create and design therapeutic education materials tailored to specific contexts.
* Develop process and resource templates for knowledge and tool repository.
* Conceptualise and visualise data, processes, and models.
* Manage and maintain the SharePoint site.

**C****ommunication**

* Write and publish blog posts for the website and LinkedIn updates aligned with MSF movement communication guidelines.
* Plan and document communication efforts together with the communication working group.

**Profile** **overview**

**Essential**


* Relevant educational background in graphic design, visual communications, media, or similar field.
* Demonstrated experience working or volunteering in graphic design and/or communications.
* Experience working in Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop).
* Experience working in Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Word, Excel).
* Demonstrated expertise in applying design principles that align with brand guidelines.
* Ability to incorporate and take on feedback and insights from all levels of stakeholders.
* Strong organisational and time management skills.
* Fluency in English, written and spoken.

**Valuable**


* Fluency in French and/or other languages.
* A good understanding and knowledge of UX / UI design.
* Experience working in public health, NGO and/or the social sector.

**What we offer**


* A collaborative and purpose-driven environment
* Opportunities for professional development
* Potential for contract extension

**How to apply**


* Submit your CV, a brief cover letter, and portfolio (either PDF or link to website)
* Deadline latest by 23:59 CET on November 23rd.
* Interview will be held online.

For questions about the role, contact johanna.christensson@stockholm.msf.org

title: UX/CX-strateg
description:
**UX/CX-strateg**

**Rollbeskrivning**  

Uppdraget är att definiera och driva en sammanhållen kundupplevelse över app, webb och andra kontaktpunkter. Du tar ett helhetsgrepp om kundresan, omsätter insikter och affärsmål till vägval, och leder prioriterade initiativ som säkrar en konsekvent, datadriven och värdeskapande upplevelse.

**Arbetsuppgifter**

* Kartlägga och optimera end-to-end-kundresor, identifiera friktion och definiera målbild.
* Formulera kanalstrategi och riktlinjer för app, webb, inloggat/öppet.
* Säkerställa igenkänning och sammanhang mellan kanaler, innehållsstruktur och inloggningsflöden.
* Använda kunddata och research för att ta fram hypoteser, prioriteringar och KPI:er.
* Driva initiativ kring AI i kundmötet samt personalisering i digitala kanaler.
* Samarbeta nära UX-designers, produktägare, arkitekter, affärsutveckling och marknad.
* Facilitering, beslutsunderlag och roadmaps i skalade agila miljöer.

**Krav**

* Flera års erfarenhet av CX/UX-strategi, digital strategi eller tjänstedesign.
* Dokumenterad förmåga att leda tvärfunktionellt och navigera många stakeholders i komplexa organisationer.
* Stark analytisk förmåga och vana att omsätta data och insikter till strategi och prioriteringar.
* Erfarenhet av kundrese-kartläggning, CX-strategier och styrning av affärs- och IT-beslut kopplat till kundupplevelse.
* God kommunikations- och faciliteringsförmåga mellan affär, IT och kundnära verksamhet.
* Förståelse för kanal- och plattformslogik: app, webb, inloggat/öppet.
* Erfarenhet av agilt arbetssätt och skalade ramverk (t.ex. SAFe) med fokus på kundcentrerad utveckling.

**Meriterande**

* Erfarenhet av federativa affärsmodeller och större digitala transformationer.
* Vana av att stärka både kund- och medarbetarupplevelse i det digitala kundmötet.
* Kunskap om CX-plattformar, CRM och säljstöd samt verksamhetsmodellering och processutveckling.
* Erfarenhet av Cloud, headless- och API-baserade lösningar.
* Praktisk tillämpning av AI och dataanalys för insiktsdriven personalisering.

**Start/Längd**

* Start: 2025-11
* Längd: till 2026-05-29

**Plats**  

Stockholm (hybrid, 50% på plats)

**Om Rasulson Consulting**  

Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med både etablerade teknikbolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda attraktiva karriärmöjligheter för dig som vill utvecklas inom digitalisering och IT. Genom vår djupa tekniska kompetens och vårt omfattande nätverk matchar vi rätt konsult med rätt uppdrag – snabbt och träffsäkert. Hos oss får du personlig rådgivning, kontinuerlig återkoppling och möjlighet att ta nästa steg i din karriär.

title: Head of Product Design
description:
#### **Lead the next phase of our product design evolution**


Every day, leading companies and financial institutions around the world rely on Quartr to make better decisions faster. Our desktop and mobile platforms help finance professionals research faster and understand deeper, while Quartr API enables third-parties to build their own solutions using our unique IR data offering. We serve some of the largest, most sophisticated, and most demanding companies in the world.


Our products are already known for their clean and intuitive design – but we’re ready to take things to the next level. We’re now looking for a **Head of Product Design** to lead the next phase of Quartr’s design evolution across our mobile and desktop platforms.


You’ll be hands-on from day one, designing for both platforms – elevating our already strong UI/UX foundation while establishing a clear future design direction. You’ll have the main ownership of product design at Quartr, and over time, you’ll build and lead a small design team. You’ll collaborate closely with all departments across the company to ensure that every pixel, flow, and feature reflects our commitment to quality and clarity. You’ll report directly to the CEO/CPO.

#### **Our design philosophy**


In the finance industry, user interfaces are often cluttered and non-intuitive; product experiences are often outdated and overly complex. We have therefore approached product development differently, focusing on making powerful functionality look beautiful and work seamlessly, instead of relying on legacy UI/UX structures.


We see taste as a core competitive advantage. We are obsessed with the small details – the small details that our competitors ignore or don’t even see – and believe they make all the difference. Great taste is a key criteria when we hire designers for both our Product and Marketing teams. We always combine intuition and taste with quantitative data and qualitative feedback when making design decisions.

#### **Responsibilities**

* Own and evolve Quartr’s product design across desktop and mobile.
  
* Collaborate with our Product, Marketing, Sales, and Engineering teams to align on design direction and execution.
  
* Design intuitive, beautiful, and high-impact user experiences that solve complex problems for our users.
  
* As we grow, you will build, mentor, and manage a small design team.
  
* Set a high standard for design quality, taste, and usability across our product suite, while aligning it closely with our brand.
  
* Encourage the use of AI and new design tools to accelerate iteration and experimentation.
  
* Contribute to a strong cross-functional culture of collaboration, creativity, and ownership.
  

#### **Requirements**

* 10+ years of professional design experience, ideally in B2B.
  
* Proven hands-on design talent across mobile and web platforms.
  
* Experience leading or managing design teams (minimum two designers).
  
* Deep understanding of UX, UI, and design systems.
  
* Experience of cross-team collaboration.
  
* Highly proficient in established design and prototyping tools (such as Figma) and up-to-date on newer AI-based design tools.
  
* Strong portfolio demonstrating great taste, craftsmanship, and systems thinking.
  

#### **Personal traits**

* **Quality-obsessed with great taste.** You sweat every detail and truly care about your work. Every pixel, motion, and interaction matters. You always speak up when something isn’t meeting your high standards.
  
* **Ownership mentality.** You think like a long-term owner, focusing on meaningful impact rather than mere activity.
* **Curious and analytical.** You’re a naturally curious person who wants to understand how things work. You dig deep to understand the problem before designing the solution.
  
* **Collaborative.** You thrive in cross-functional teams and value strong alignment between design, marketing, and product.
  

#### **Why join Quartr**

* An opportunity to lead product design at a company that values design craft deeply and knows that quality always matters, even in the smallest details.
  
* Work in a company that values simplicity, quality, and long-term impact over short-term trends.
  
* Collaborate with a sharp, passionate team where the best idea wins – no egos, no bureaucracy.
  
* Competitive compensation, stock options, and the opportunity to grow into Head of Design for the entire company.

title: Hub Manager / Team Manager
description:
### **Din nya roll**


Vi söker nu en strukturerad och inspirerande Hub Manager / Team Manager för ett föräldravikariat under ett år hos ett av Sveriges största energibolag.


Här blir du en central del av avdelningen CX and Digital Channels, som ansvarar för att utveckla digitala kundmöten, förbättra kundresan och driva innovation inom digitala tjänster.


Som Hub Manager / Team Manager kommer du att leda ett tvärfunktionellt utvecklingsteam med utvecklare, UX-designers, QA-specialister och Scrum Master. Tillsammans skapar ni användarvänliga och effektiva digitala lösningar som stärker kundupplevelsen.


Även om du inte har formellt personalansvar, är detta en ledarroll där coaching, prioritering och daglig styrning av teamets arbete står i fokus.  

  

**Andra förekommande arbetsuppgifter och ansvarsområden:**


* Ansvara för budget, resursplanering och resursallokering
* Säkerställa effektiva förvaltningsprocesser, IT-säkerhet och efterlevnad
* Driva kontinuerlig förbättring av arbetssätt och leverans
* Följa upp mål och resultat i samarbete med produktägare
* Vara länken mellan IT, CX-design, Arkitektur, Kommunikation och andra avdelningar
* Delta i ledningsforum och bidra till utvecklingen av gemensamma processer och rutiner
* Upprätthålla och teckna nya leverantörsavtal vid behov

### **För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll behöver du**

* Mångårig erfarenhet av liknande ledarroller, gärna som Engineering Manager, projektledare eller team lead.
* Gillar att arbeta tvärfunktionellt och har god förståelse för både teknik, användare och affär.
* Trygg i budget-, förvaltnings- och säkerhetsansvar.
* En naturlig coach som får teamet att växa och leverera tillsammans.
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på både svenska och engelska.
* Meriterande: Erfarenhet som Scrum master.

### **Vem är du?**


Dina personliga egenskaper kännetecknas av att du är prestigelös, en tydlig ledare som kan motivera dina medarbetare och att du har lätt att samarbeta med andra medarbetare på bolaget. Du är strukturerad, lösningsorienterad och har förmåga att se helheten och arbeta långsiktigt, samtidigt som du kan prioritera och lösa akuta problem om det behövs.

### **Välkommen med din ansökan**

  

Anställningens omfattning: Heltid, 100%  

Anställningsform: Tidsbegränsad anställning som konsult via JobBusters.  

Arbetsmodell: 3 dagar onsite på kontoret i Solna, 2 dagar på distans/hemifrån.  

Start: 2026-01-12  

Slut: 2027-01-31 (föräldravikariat)  

Utvalda förmåner: Kollektivavtal, Friskvårdsbidrag, Benifex med mera  

I din ansökan: *säkerställ att det tydligt framgår att du är kvalificerad utefter kundens önskade kvalifikationer.*

  

### **Bra att känna till!**


Vi går igenom ansökningarna löpande. Då processerna i konsultvärlden ofta går snabbt kan tjänsten tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum – vänta därför inte med att skicka in din ansökan!


Du behöver inte skriva ett personligt brev utan i stället ber vi dig svara på urvalsfrågorna i samband med ansökan.

title: Konsultuppdrag | Team Manager - Webbhub
description:
**Solna (konsulten måste vara på kontoret minst 3dgr/vecka)**

  

Vi söker nu en engagerad och strukturerad Team Lead (Hub Manager) för ett års rotation under föräldraledighet till vår kund. Konsulten kommer att ha en central roll i avdelningen CX and Digital Channels. Avdelningen ansvarar för att driva kundinsiktsarbete inom Eldistribution samt äga och utveckla de digitala kanalerna mot kunder och partners med målet att förbättra kundupplevelsen och utveckla användarvänliga digitala tjänster och friktionsfria kundresor. Som Hub Manager kommer man att leda arbetet i ett av avdelningens team som består av en dynamisk sammansättning av utvecklare, UX-designers, kvalitetssäkrare och SCRUM master. Teamet jobbar nära övriga kollegor inom avdelningen såsom produktägare, affärsanalytiker, tjänstdesigners, användaranalytiker och även digitala kommunikatörer. Konsulten har ansvar för IT-budget, förvaltning, säkerhet, samt för leveransen tillsammans med produktägarna. Detta är en team-lead roll där man leder det dagliga arbetet och jobbar med flera personalrelaterade frågor utan att ha det formella personalansvaret.  

  

Om Webbhubben  

Webbhubben är ett agilt utvecklingsteam som ansvarar för UX-design, underhåll och utveckling av webprodukter. Webbhubben arbetar kontinuerligt med förbättringar och nya funktioner, verksamhetsutvecklingsprojekt, adaptive och förvaltning. Detta görs i nära samarbete med affärsanalytiker och produktägare i tvärfunktionella team. Teamet har personal från IT och från CX and Digital Channels. Webbhubben är ett kreativt och lösningsorienterat team som arbetar nära affären för att driva, utveckla och förvalta digitala tjänster och användarupplevelser  

  

Arbetsuppgifter  

* Ansvara för budget, resursplanering och resursallokering för Webbhubben
* Driva och utveckla förvaltningsprocesser samt säkerställa säkerhet och efterlevnad
* Stötta och coacha teammedlemmar
* Vara länken mellan IT, CX-design, Arkitektur, Kommunikation och andra avdelningar – möjliggöra smidigt samarbete
* Följa upp mål, resultat och kontinuerligt förbättra arbetssätt
* Ansvara för att upprätthålla och teckna nya avtal
* Delta i ledningsforum tillsammans med andra teamleads inom CX and Digital Channels
* Säkra att vi följer riktlinjer, arbetssätt och processer. Samt att vara delaktig i att förbättra dessa kontinuerligt.


Skills: • Du har erfarenhet av liknande ledarroller, gärna som Engineering Manager, projektledare eller team lead. Erfarenhet som SCRUM master är starkt  

meriterande  

* Du gillar att arbeta tvärfunktionellt och har god förståelse för både teknik, användare och affär
* Du är trygg i budget-, förvaltnings- och säkerhetsansvar
* Du är en naturlig coach som får teamet att växa och leverera tillsammans
* Du kommunicerar obehindrat på både svenska och engelska


Keywords:  

Education: SCRUM Master/Engeering manager bakgrund. **Om oss**

*Senterprise är ett ledande rekryteringsbolag inom IT och en oberoende förmedlare av frilansande konsulter. Med aktiv headhunting, search och djup teknisk förståelse hjälper vi några av Sveriges främsta arbetsgivare att hitta rätt kandidater, både för anställning och konsultuppdrag.*

*Läs vidare på* *www.senterprise.se*

title: Product Designer
description:
**Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal – to be your trusted financial partner. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today** **–** **bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders** **–** **thanks to all the 450+ amazing people who work here.**

**Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.**

**We are now looking for our next Product Designer.**


As a Product Designer at Sambla Group, you’ll play a key role in shaping the experience of our products - from first insight to launched solution and beyond.


You’ll work closely with Product Managers, Local product leads, developers, and data analysts to understand problems, explore opportunities, and ensure that what we build truly benefits our customers.  

  

**The position entails a wide range of responsibilities including, but not limited to:**

* Manage the end-to-end design process, from research and concept to final UI and implementation
* Responsible for identifying and understanding user needs and pain points through research and data
* Drive design iterations through testing, prototyping, and measuring impact on product outcomes
* Develop clear, accessible, and visually refined interfaces that align with our design principles
* Collaborate on product strategy and roadmap prioritization
* Work iteratively, testing ideas early, learning fast, and continuously improving based on insights and data

Contribute to and evolve our design system  
* 

##### **Who You Are**


You’re curious, analytical, and collaborative. You think about more than just final UI and user flows, you care about outcomes. You enjoy working autonomously, taking initiatives, and balancing speed with quality.  

You enjoy experimenting, iterating fast, and learning from real user behavior.


This is a role for someone who wants to own the full journey.  

From raw insights to shipped products and helping to shape how design drives value across Sambla Group.  



  

##### **Requirements**

* 4+ years of experience in UX/UI or Product Design (or equivalent hands-on experience)
  
* Strong portfolio demonstrating end-to-end design thinking. From problem framing to final UI
  
* Good understanding of front-end principles and how design translates into code, enabling smooth collaboration and confident handoffs to development
  
* Comfortable conducting user research and usability testing
  
* Skilled in modern design tools (Figma, prototyping tools, etc.)
  
* Strong understanding and knowledge of accessibility, design systems, and responsive design principles
  
* Experience collaborating closely with product managers and dev teams in agile teams
  
* Data-informed mindset - able to connect qualitative insights with quantitative outcomes
  
* Excellent communication skills in English
  
* Self-driven and proactive, with a strong sense of ownership and accountability

  

**What we offer:**

* Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
* A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees.
* We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
* A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.  

  

Please note!
  

As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.

title: UX Designer - Games
description:
As a UX Designer you will be working on one of our Game Projects in a cross-disciplinary team, taking ownership for UX design of game features and driving initiatives within those to improve the end-user experience. You will be part of designing and shipping new features for live service products, while balancing maintenance of existing features.
   

  

 To thrive in this role we think you have experience working with games, designing for multiple platforms and input methods such as PC, console or mobile, and an interest in UX Research. The bar for UX in games is rising, and we’re pushing to stay ahead of the curve. Join us and help shape what comes next!
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Collaborate in cross-disciplinary teams and align stakeholders around design decisions to ensure shared understanding and designs.
* Create designs using user flows, wireframes, interactive prototypes, that adhere to design systems and style guides.
* Work proactively, identifying gaps in the user experience to inform improvements
* You don’t think of just screens, you think in systems. Consider edge cases early on, flexible design solutions, and drive consistency with creativity.
* Help leveling-up UX understanding and skills at Embark, drive the discipline forward in the studio.
* Foster a culture of design sharing, feedback, and critique within the team, to leverage the team’s combined expertise in finding the best solutions.


**We would love if you have**
* A portfolio showcasing a couple of relevant projects from previous work.
* 5+ years of experience within UX/UI or product design, or similar.
* Experience working data-driven to inform design decisions.
* Experience working with live service cross-platform products
* Systematic approach to design
* Experience with Unreal Engine is a plus, but not required
* Familiarity with user research methods
* A creative and curious mind with a passion for user-centered design
* An interest in games and player experiences
* Fluency in English


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Acne Studios Digital Designer
description:
Acne Studios is a progressive luxury house and through collaboration and curiosity, we set high aspirations and strive for excellence. We value everyone's contribution and embrace feedback to develop ourselves and others. We aim to minimise our environmental impact across all our operations and to address societal challenges in the way we conduct our business.
   

  

 As Digital Designer at our Stockholm HQ you will play a pivotal role in the rapid, creative and commercial expansion of our online store acnestudios.com. Digital Design plays an important part of Acne Studios' ambition of being at the forefront of luxury E-Commerce. In this position you will have a key role in the day-to-day enhancement of our online store, ensuring the input from the Creative Director and business stakeholders is implemented within agreed deadlines.
   

  

 We are looking for someone with exceptional attention to detail, a creative problem-solver and a team player with a keen interest in design, fashion and technology. The position will be based at Acne Studios' headquarters in Stockholm and reports to the Head of Digital Studio.
   

  

 CULTURE OF COLLABORATION
   

  

 We firmly believe that when you feel supported, included, and trusted, it enables you to enjoy your work and thrive in it. You will be a part of a team of colleagues with diverse roles and backgrounds, each with their unique skills and experiences.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Design innovative and engaging visuals for our digital platforms, including acnestudios.com, social media campaigns, newsletters, collaborations, and more.
* Solve complex visual challenges while upholding the aesthetic integrity of the Acne Studios brand.
* Collaborate with UX designers, art directors, front-end developers, merchandisers, content publishers, and the marketing team.
* Maintain design consistency across all digital channels, ensuring alignment with the brand's creative direction.
* Stay ahead of emerging trends in digital design, fashion, and technology to keep our digital presence at the cutting edge.


**Who You Are**
 You have high aspirations and focus on details that create substantial impact. You enjoy working as a team and you embrace feedback to develop yourself and others. You are curious and thrive in a dynamic environment. Cooperation, respect, and clear communication are important, along with your ambition to learn and grow. If these qualities speak to you, we would love to have you on our team.
   

  

**Specific Personal Qualities For This Role**
* A strong eye for design with an understanding of front-end implementation, particularly in an E-commerce context.
* A collaborative mindset with a proactive and innovative approach to problem-solving.
* The ability to remain calm and focused under pressure, managing tight deadlines without compromising on quality.


**Specific Experience And Knowledge For This Role**
* At least five years of experience in digital or web design
* Proficiency in Figma
* Strong verbal and written communication skills in English
* An online portfolio showcasing your previous work


**Please attach a portfolio showcasing relevant work as part of your application.**
 What matters most to us is not whether you master all the listed knowledge and skills. We are dedicated to recognising the potential in each individual. We embrace diversity of people as well as ideas and viewpoints and encourage everyone's individual expression of their own identity.

description:

 Every day, leading companies and financial institutions around the world rely on Quartr to make better decisions faster.
