You will act as a technical expert in HR solutions, integrations, and system configuration, helping shape how the system supports business operations across the DOVISTA group.
   

  

 You’ll collaborate closely with HR, IT, and external partners across Europe, ensuring robust integrations and a scalable, future-ready system landscape. After go-live, you’ll continue driving optimization, maintenance, and innovation.
   

  

**Your responsibilities include:**
* Design, configure, and implement HRIS solutions and related applications within a complex ecosystem
* Act as the technical owner of HR systems – continuously improving architecture, integrations, and processes
* Translate business requirements into effective, secure, and scalable technical solutions
* Collaborate with HR, IT, and key stakeholders to ensure system solutions deliver measurable business value
* Ensure best-practice use of HR technology, data governance, and system integrations
* Design and maintain integrations, data flows, and reporting frameworks across platforms
* Contribute to IT process improvements and apply best-practice methodologies (e.g., ITIL, agile frameworks)
* Support post-implementation development, performance tuning, and troubleshooting


**This is what you will contribute with:**
* Deep technical understanding of HR systems (e.g., HRIS/ERP platforms)
* Experience with system integration, configuration, and data management
* Strong understanding of HR processes and how to translate them into system logic
* Analytical and structured mindset, with the ability to navigate both technical and functional discussions
* Clear communication and collaboration skills across functions and borders


**Who are you?**
 You are a tech-savvy, curious, and collaborative problem-solver who thrives at the intersection of HR and IT. You enjoy tackling complex system challenges and contributing to long-term digital development.We believe you bring:
   

  

* A university degree and 3+ years of experience with HRIS implementation or system management
* Solid understanding of HRIS functionality – e.g., Core HR, Compensation, Recruitment, or Onboarding
* Experience from at least one full-cycle HR system implementation, preferably in an international setting
* Familiarity with data reporting and analytics tools within HR
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to work cross-functionally
* Fluent English and minimum basic Swedish
* Willingness to travel occasionally within Europe during the implementation phase


**About DOVISTA**
 DOVISTA Group is the leading supplier of facade windows and exterior doors in Europe, with approximately 6,600 employees across 10 European countries. We are owned by the VKR Group – a Danish family and foundation-owned company with around 19,000 employees worldwide.
   

  

 In Sweden, we operate under the brands Svenska Fönster, Mockfjärds, and VELFAC – with a total of around 600 employees. We offer a collaborative and development-oriented culture, driven by continuous improvement and long-term sustainability.
   

  

 The position is based in Solna, with regular interaction with our international offices and teams. Our Swedish HQ and production facility are located in Edsbyn, and we also have a regional office in Borlänge.
   

  

*Location: Solna, Sweden (Hybrid)*
**Contact**
 In this recruitment, DOVISTA collaborates with Wise IT. For more information, please contact Recruitment Consultant Sandra Åhs at sandra.ahs@wiseit.se.
   

  

 Please note: We are unable to accept applications via email due to GDPR regulations. All applications must be submitted through the official application system.
   

  

 We review applications continuously, and interviews are conducted on a rolling basis.
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Corporate Tax Analyst
description:
**Karo Healthcare, a dynamic and growing healthcare company, is all about making smart choices for everyday healthcare.**

 With a wide-ranging portfolio across seven categories including medical products, we own and sell over 80 brands in about 90 countries. Our portfolio includes such brands as E45, Pevaryl, Lamisil, Nutravita, Decubal and many others.
   

 Our core belief in empowering people to make intelligent health decisions drives our growth strategy, blending organic expansion and M&A.
   





 Join us at Karo Healthcare on our exciting journey. We're currently looking for a
 **Tax Analyst** 
 for our office in
 **Stockholm** 
 .
   




**What's in it for you?**

**An opportunity to grow your career in a fast-moving, international environment.**
 You'll be part of a collaborative global finance team where your work truly makes an impact. Expect hands-on exposure across markets, ongoing development, and the chance to contribute to a company that's expanding through both innovation and acquisitions.
   




**What you'll be doing**
* Support financial controllers and coordinate with tax advisors in the preparation and review of international tax filings and reports
* Monitor developments in international tax regulations and assess their impact on the business
* Assist in preparing tax provisions for financial statements under IFRS/GAAP
* Provide tax advisory support to internal stakeholders across markets
* Help manage responses to tax audits and inquiries from tax authorities
* Contribute to group tax policies, guidelines, and governance processes
* Support tax-related aspects of business restructurings, geo-expansions, and M&A integrations


**Requirements**
* Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or a related field


* 2-4 years of experience in tax, preferably with exposure to international tax
* Experience in a multinational corporation or public accounting firm is a strong plus
* Good understanding of international tax principles and compliance frameworks
* Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and financial systems
* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, global environment and manage multiple priorities


**Benefits**
* Opportunity to create, grow, and encourage


* Apart from a competitive salary pack, there are lots of growth opportunities to meet your personal ambitions
* Flexible schedule and life work balance
* Responsibility for exciting and challenging projects that have a direct, visible impact on our customers and the industry
* Very positive work environment in a young, international, and motivated team
* Start-up spirit while being a part of the large international organization with strong values



  
 



*Karo Healthcare has a Diverse & Inclusive environment. We are looking for qualified candidates irrespective of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, race, religion, national origin, disability or age.*

title: Tech lead digital innovation - accelerera innovation
description:
Vill du omsätta idéer till prototyper och vara med och driva digital innovation som gör skillnad för Sveriges energiförsörjning? Svenska kraftnät är en nyckelaktör i energiomställningen. Vår IT-division växer för att möjliggöra en fördubblad elproduktion och en fossilfri framtid. Med ny teknik ökar vi både infrastrukturens kapacitet och utvecklingstakten inom digitalisering och processer.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en tech lead till vårt innovationslabb som kommer bidra till att höja innovationstakten och snabbt testa nya tekniska lösningar.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 I rollen leder du arbetet från problemidentifiering till färdig prototyp. Du arbetar nära verksamheten för att förstå behov, skapa lösningshypoteser och verifiera dem genom prototyputveckling. Mycket av arbetet sker i teknikens framkant och med AI som central komponent - både som utvecklingsverktyg och del av lösningen.
   

  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter**
* Leda workshops för att identifiera problem och möjligheter tillsammans med verksamheten.
* Ta fram lösningshypoteser och utveckla prototyper, exempelvis med agentbaserad utveckling eller prototyptjänster.
* Experimentera med och använda AI i utvecklingsprojekt.
* Effektivisera och automatisera utvecklingsprocesser.
* Presentera resultat och inspirera till fortsatt utveckling.


 Du kommer att få möjlighet att delta i kurser, workshops och konferenser för att hålla dig uppdaterad inom de senaste teknikerna och trenderna inom AI och digital innovation. Du kommer också att kunna utvecklas inom framtidens energiteknik hos den centrala spelaren i Sverige för energiomställningen.
   

  

**Om dig**
**Skallkrav**
 Vi söker dig som har god samarbetsförmåga och tycker om att skapa resultat tillsammans med kollegor. För att trivas i rollen ser vi att du är lösningsorienterad och lägger vikt vid att hålla dig informerad och lära nytt inom ditt yrkesområde. Som person är du organiserad och bra på att planera och slutföra det som påbörjas. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Du har en akademisk examen från högskola eller universitet, alternativt motsvarande kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt. Du har även:
   

  

* God programmeringskunskap (flerårig aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet som systemutvecklare).
* Erfarenhet av att använda AI både i egen utveckling och som del av en teknisk lösning.
* Erfarenhet från start-up, innovationsavdelning eller motsvarande innovativa miljöer.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


 Vi ser det som
 **meriterande** 
 om du har:
   

  

* Kunskap inom Design Thinking eller motsvarande användar- och problemorienterat angreppssätt.
* Erfarenhet av affärs- eller verksamhetsutveckling.
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom säkerhetskänslig verksamhet.


**Bra att veta**
* Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm / Sundbyberg.
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %
* Sista ansökningsdag är den 17 november 2025. Vi använder urvalsfrågor istället för personligt brev.
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning.
* I denna rekryteringsprocess tillämpas tester för slutkandidat/er.
* Förmåner | Svenska kraftnät


 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Experis. Vid frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta rekryteringskonsult Carina Eyoma, carina.eyoma@se.experis.com, 073 086 22 75. Vid frågor om tjänsten kontakta gärna rekryterande chef Daniel Hellqvist, 072-590 24 00. Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72 och Erica Midfjäll ST, 010 475 87 31. Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se
   

  

 Jobba här - bli en viktig del av vår energiframtid | Svenska kraftnät
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare i samband med rekrytering, vi har upphandlade avtal som gäller för Svenska kraftnät som statlig myndighet.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning.
   

  

 För anställning på Svenska kraftnät kan det vara ett krav på svenskt medborgarskap i vissa befattningar. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.
   

  

 För mer information om säkerhetsprövning
   

  

 Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar.
   

  

 Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss:
   

  

 Lär känna oss på Svenska

title: Operations Associate - Supply Activation
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 Are you a detail-oriented team player excited to dive into the foundation of Delivery Operations at Wolt by working in the Courier Activation team? Do you enjoy working in a highly-dynamic, fast faced and execution minded environment? Are you passionate about helping others, be they friends, customers, partners or colleagues? If this sounds like you, we'd love to chat!
   

  

**We welcome applications from the North Region; Denmark, Estonia, Finland, Iceland, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Norway and Sweden.**
 What you’ll be doing
   

  

 The Courier Activation team ensures that the right number of Courier Partners are activated based on each city’s needs, whether that means engaging newly ready-to-deliver couriers, activating active ones, or re-engaging those who have churned.
   

  

 As an Operations Associate, you’ll focus on engaging Courier Partners during key moments when additional supply is needed to balance demand; such as undersupply periods, special events, weather disruptions, and city launches or re-launches. In these moments, timely activation is essential to maintaining strong operational performance.
   

  

**Day-to-day in this role you’ll:**
* Identifying activation opportunities to improve courier availability across the region, supporting a high-quality experience for customers, Courier Partners, and merchants
* Owning the end-to-end execution of activation campaigns, from setting up payment rules to crafting and delivering communications
* Collaborating with other OPS & Support teams and responding to their activation-related queries
* Contributing to the development and execution of projects that enhance activation efficiency
* Sharing ideas for improvement with the wider Operations team and across Wolt, including Delivery Operations, Courier Experience, and Product teams


 Our humble expectations
   

  

* You have excellent interpersonal skills - you will be working with awesome people from diverse backgrounds across countries in the northern region of Europe (Finland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Iceland, Luxembourg and the Baltics)
* You have excellent or native-level proficiency in both verbal and written English. Other languages from the Nordic regions are a big plus!
* You are strong at working with deadlines and are not afraid of voluminous tasks
* You are highly detail-oriented and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
* You preferably have experience in customer service or similar and are keen to solve problems
* You are tech savvy and a quick learner
* You have a can-do attitude and are ready to roll up your sleeves and get to work in a high-growth and evolving environment
* Bonus skills: you are strong at working with data and basic tools (such as Google Sheets) or Iterable
* You have a right to work in the country you're applying in


 What we offer
   

  

* Meaningful impact - Your work directly influences courier availability and customer experience across multiple cities and countries.
* Dynamic environment - No two days are the same. You’ll work on fast-paced activations tied to real-time needs
* Room to grow - Share your ideas, lead projects, and help shape how we engage Courier Partners across the region.
* People-first culture - At Wolt, we put people at the center - whether it’s Courier Partners, customers, merchants, or you.


 Next steps
   

  

 If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going! We highly recommend including a brief cover letter to help your application stand out.
   

  

 We will be reviewing applications and inviting people to interviews on an on-going basis, so we encourage sending your application ASAP.
   

  

 Please note that we do
 **not** 
 accept applications coming in via email. Please submit your application via our job portal.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Product Application Engineer (PAE) - Medium Voltage
description:
Product Application Engineer (PAE) - Digital Power Medium Voltage Portfolio
 
**Location:** 
 Nordic Region (Focus: Sweden & Denmark)
   

  




**Your Mission** 

 As a Product Application Engineer (PAE) in Schneider Electric’s Digital Power team, you’ll be the technical bridge between our innovative medium voltage solutions and our key customers in the power and grid sector. You’ll empower utilities, TSOs, and DSOs to modernize their infrastructure—driving the energy transition through digitization, decarbonization, and electrification.
 


**What You’ll Do** 
* **Consultative Pre-Sales (50%)**
 Partner with Key Account Managers and Offer Sales Specialists to support tenders and customer engagements. Guide customers through technical specifications, focusing on medium voltage products and SCADA systems.
* **Training & Value-Added Services (40%)**
 Deliver targeted training to end users and partners, ensuring they get the most from our Digital Power Medium Voltage portfolio. Collaborate with the Offer Manager to tailor training using the latest tools and materials. Provide billable value-added services as needed.
* **Technical Support (10%)**
 Act as a technical expert for Level 1 and 2 support, working closely with our Customer Care Center. Clearly communicate when support transitions to billable services.


**Your Expertise** 
* Degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent experience with medium voltage systems
* Hands-on experience in pre-sales, after-sales, installation, or consulting—especially with protection relays, arc flash protection, or RTUs
* Fluent in Swedish and English, with strong communication and customer-facing skills
* In-depth knowledge of local substation standards
* Collaborative, proactive, and open-minded approach
* Comfortable in a multinational, cross-border environment
* Self-driven, with a passion for technical excellence and customer success


**Why Schneider Electric?** 
* **Impact:** 
 Play a key role in the energy transition, helping customers modernize and future-proof their operations.
* **Growth:** 
 Join a dynamic, supportive team with opportunities for professional development.
* **Innovation:** 
 Work with cutting-edge digital power solutions in a global leader in energy management.


**Team & Reporting** 

 You’ll be part of the Digital Power commercial team for the Nordic & Baltic region, focusing on Sweden. You’ll report to Frederik Moeller (Denmark) and collaborate closely with Power System Sweden, led by Andreas Hamping (Stockholm).
 



  
 



**Ready to help shape the future of energy? Apply now and join us on our mission to make energy safer, smarter, and more sustainable!** 




  
 










  
 




**Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?**






 When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that our  IMPACT values - Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork - starts with us.
 





 IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.
 





 We are looking for IMPACT Makers; exceptional people who turn sustainability ambitions into actions at the intersection of automation, electrification, and digitization. We celebrate IMPACT Makers and believe everyone has the potential to be one.
 





 Become an IMPACT Maker with Schneider Electric - apply today!
 





 €36 billion global revenue
   



 +13% organic growth
   



 150 000+ employees in 100+ countries
   



 #1 on the Global 100 World’s most sustainable corporations
 




  
 







  
 




 You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.
 




  
 




*Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best. We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate, and ‘inclusion’ is one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do.* 





  
 




*At Schneider Electric, we uphold the highest standards of ethics and compliance, and we believe that trust is a foundational value. Our Trust Charter is our Code of Conduct and demonstrates our commitment to ethics, safety, sustainability, quality and cybersecurity, underpinning every aspect of our business and our willingness to behave and respond respectfully and in good faith to all our stakeholders. You can find out more about our Trust Charter here*





*Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.*

title: Junior Test Developer – Hårdvarunära testautomation i C++
description:
Är du nyutexaminerad (eller erfaren) ingenjör inom mjukvara och vill växa i en roll där du kombinerar programmering, test och avancerad teknik? Här får du arbeta med högpresterande system för bild- och datahantering, och vara med och bygga upp en testmiljö som säkerställer prestanda och kvalitet i avancerade applikationer. Du kommer in i ett erfaret team där du får stöd och utrymme att utvecklas, samtidigt som du bidrar till att forma avdelningens testinfrastruktur.
 



  





**OM TJÄNSTEN** 




 Som Test Developer kommer du att arbeta i en miljö med hög teknisk nivå och spännande utmaningar. Du får möjlighet att kombinera programmering i C++ med testautomatisering, och arbeta nära både mjukvara och hårdvara.
 



  





 I rollen kommer du bland annat att:
 


* Utveckla och underhålla tester i C++ för avancerade system med höga krav på prestanda.
* Självständigt bygga upp en testmiljö och ett testframework från grunden.
* Skapa simuleringar och testdubbletter för att möjliggöra testning även utan fysisk hårdvara.
* Utforma och automatisera regressionssviter.
* Säkerställa att tester körs effektivt via CI/CD-pipelines (t.ex. GitLab).
* Analysera testresultat och bidra till att förbättra prestanda och stabilitet.
* Arbeta i en Linuxmiljö nära både utveckling och test.



  





**VI SÖKER DIG SOM** 



* Har en avslutad ingenjörsutbildning med inriktning mjukvara.
* Har programmerat i C++ under studier, projekt eller exjobb.
* Har studerat och/eller arbetat med något testverktyg eller testframework (t.ex. GoogleTest, Catch2, PyTest, JUnit).
* Är nyfiken på hårdvarunära testning och vill förstå hur mjukvara och hårdvara samverkar.
* Trivs i en Linux-miljö och gillar att analysera, testa och lösa problem.
* Har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska



  





 Meriterande:
 


* Erfarenhet av CI/CD (t.ex. GitLab) eller versionshantering i Git.
* Kunskap om simulering, mockning eller testdubbletter.
* Erfarenhet av kamerateknik, bildanalys eller andra inbyggda system.



  





 Som person är du problemlösande, framåt och ansvarstagande. Eftersom du självständigt kommer bygga upp detta från grunden söker vi någon som har förmågan att ta initiativ för att komma framåt utan att nödvändigtvis ha tydliga riktlinjer kring hur det ska ske. Nyfikenhet och kreativ problemlösning är viktiga faktorer i gruppen.
 



  





**OM ANSTÄLLNINGEN** 




 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag vilket innebär att du kommer till en början att vara anställd av Friday. Ambitionen från vår kund och vår sida är att du efter en tid blir direktanställd hos företaget.
 



  





**ÖVRIG INFO** 




 Omfattning: Tillsvidare
 



 Start: Enligt överenskommelse
 



 Placering: Stockholm, norrort
 



 Rekryteringsansvarig: Anna Persson
 



 Lön: Marknadsmässig
 



 Ansök genom att klicka på länken nedan. Kom ihåg att vara snabb med din ansökan då vi gör löpande urval av kandidater och att annonsen kan stängs ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals och intervjufasen.
 



  





**OM FRIDAY** 




*Genom att vara en partner både till våra kandidater och kunder strävar vi efter att hitta den bästa matchningen. Det gör vi genom att lära känna våra kunder och kandidater på riktigt! Vi ser självklart till att kunskaps- och erfarenhetskrav matchar, men framförallt lägger vi vikt vid samsyn kring värderingar och företagskultur som båda parter värdesätter.* 




*Vår passion är att hjälpa människor till rätt roll, arbetsplats och sammanhang inom IT och teknik. Därför grundade vi Friday med ambition att hjälpa dig till jobbet som ger dig fredagskänslan – varje dag!* 




*Vi riktar oss främst till dig som är i början av din karriär eller studerar vid högskola/universitet inom IT och Teknik.* 




*Vår övertygelse är att människor uppnår sin fulla potential när man ser fram emot att gå till jobbet varje morgon. ”Friday – everyday”, hur låter det?*

title: Head of Talent
description:
As of 2 September 2025, Tietoevry Tech Services, earlier part of Tietoevry Group, will operate as a standalone company. We'll soon be operating under a new name:
 **Vivicta** 
 . You will discover more about our new brand by the end of the year. Read more.
   

  

 You may apply by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.
   

  

 Vivicta (formerly known as Tietoevry Tech Services) is thrilled to embark on an exciting journey under new ownership. This change creates new opportunities, challenges, and growth avenues for both our company and our employees. We are looking for talented people who want to join us on this exciting journey and help shape the digital landscape in the Nordics.
   

  

 At Vivicta, we enhance the Nordic quality of life through transformational technology, allowing us to spend more time with loved ones. We do this by innovating, implementing and automating new data driven digitalized solutions. Our expertise is helping Nordic societies and businesses modernize and develop processes, applications, and infrastructure, providing reliable, secure, and efficient IT services. We'll continue to shape the future of technology in the Nordics together with our customers.
   

  

**Vivicta Leadership Principles**
 At Vivicta, we live by GRIT – Guts, Result, Integrity, and Team. These principles guide how we lead, collaborate, and grow:
   

  

* Guts: We challenge the status quo and pioneer new ways of working.
* Result: We focus on delivering enhanced impact and business value.
* Integrity: We act with transparency, high ethics, and trust.
* Team: We empower, develop, and unite people behind a shared vision.


 We are now seeking a visionary
 **Head of Talent** 
 to lead our global Talent Operations into the future, driving business impact and growth
   

  

**Your Mission**
 As Head of Talent, you will lead and develop our core talent operations:
   

  

* Talent Acquisition -> attract and acquire the best talent
* Staffing & Workforce Transformation -> rotate and allocate, and utilize talent in impactful projects
* Learning & Development -> continuously right skill and develop our talent


 You don’t need to be a subject matter expert in each area—but you do need to be a strategic leader with a strong transformation mindset. You bring clarity to complexity, inspire cross-functional teams, and embed scalable, human-centric ways of working across geographies. You understand how to align people, culture, and capability with business strategy—and you know how to deliver measurable impact.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
**Lead with Vision**
* Define and execute a global talent strategy that supports our business transformation and growth.
* Inspire and guide our HR and talent teams across all 9 countries, fostering collaboration and a shared purpose.


**Operate Globally, Act Locally**
* Build frameworks that scale across diverse markets—from Finland to India—while respecting local cultures and needs.
* Lead with empathy, adaptability and accountability in cross-cultural environments.


**Modernize Talent Operations**
* Champion agile, experience-led talent strategies that leverage digital tools, design thinking, and data-driven decision-making to drive digital transformation across talent processes, enhancing agility and scalability
* Shape a learning culture that supports leadership development, internal mobility, and future skills.


**Be a Change Leader**
* Lead talent transformation as we establish our stand-alone company.
* Guide teams through change with clarity, empathy, and purpose—ensuring alignment between people, process, and strategy.
* Challenge the status quo and foster a culture of continuous improvement.


**Drive Strategic Execution**
* Build strong stakeholder engagement across business units, HR, and leadership to ensure alignment and impact.
* Translate strategic vision into actionable plans and deliver results across geographies.
* Ensure talent initiatives are implemented efficiently and sustainably.


**Enable Strategic Workforce Planning**
* Align roles, capabilities, and organizational structures with business goals.
* Use analytics and insight to informed decisions and optimize workforce deployment.


**What You Bring**
* Proven leadership experience in transformation, talent strategy, and employee experience—ideally in international and consulting environments.
* Strong understanding of talent acquisition, workforce alignment, and leadership development.
* Experience designing and delivering learning programs and future-of-work initiatives.
* Strategic mindset with operational execution skills and a people-first approach.
* Excellent communication, stakeholder engagement, and cross-functional collaboration abilities.
* Ability to lead and understand a fully hybrid organization across cultures.
* Passion for building inclusive, high-performing teams and shaping the future of work.
* Demonstrated ability to lead with GRIT


**What We Offer**
 This is a unique opportunity to build and shape the Talent Operations function in a newly independent company. You’ll be part of a collaborative, forward-thinking team that values professional growth, open culture, and a healthy work-life balance. We offer a flexible hybrid work model and encourage continuous learning and development.
   

  

**Ready to Lead Talent Transformation?**
 If you are ready to take on this exciting challenge and be a key player in our global HR community, we invite you to apply! Please attach your application letter and CV. Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis, so we encourage you to apply today. For any questions regarding this role, please contact Head of People & Culture Hanna Vuorikoski (hanna.vuorikoski@vivicta.com)
   

  

 Vivicta is committed to diversity and welcomes applicants of all genders, ages, abilities, ethnicities, orientations, beliefs, and backgrounds.
   

  

 Vivicta declines calls from recruitment companies.

title: Product Lead, Courier Compliance
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We are looking for a Product Lead to join
 **the Courier Group, Compliance Team.** 
 The Courier Group builds products that power the end-to-end courier experience and logistics at Wolt, from onboarding to earnings, engagement, task assignment, and compliance. The group spans multiple product teams working together to ensure that couriers can start, operate, and grow on Wolt safely, efficiently, and in compliance with local regulations.
   

  

 The Compliance Team ensures that Wolt’s courier platform operates within the boundaries of diverse regulatory environments, while maintaining a simple and trusted experience for couriers, third-party service providers, and internal teams. This includes identity verification, document management, classification, and privacy safeguards, and scalable compliance automation.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

 As the Product Lead for Compliance, you’ll work with a cross-functional team of exceptional engineers, designers, analysts, and product people in a high-impact, high-visibility role. You’ll define the vision and roadmap for courier compliance at Wolt, balancing business scalability, user trust, and regulatory integrity. You’ll connect with country teams to understand local regulatory requirements and cultural nuances, collaborate with legal and operations partners, and align with other product teams to make sure compliance flows are seamlessly embedded across the courier lifecycle.
   

  

 Your work will include leading multiple projects and cross-team initiatives across the product lifecycle, from discovery to delivery. You’ll partner with Legal, Operations, and Policy teams to design compliance systems that are both locally adaptive and globally scalable. You’ll ensure that product experiences for different courier models remain clearly distinct and compliant, while driving automation and efficiency in ID verification, document management, and audit workflows. A key part of your role will be developing a deep understanding of couriers, regulators, and internal users, enabling you to build solutions that make compliance seamless and effortless for everyone involved.
   

  

 Our Humble Expectations
   

  

 You could come to this role from a variety of backgrounds, but ideally, you have:
   

  

* Demonstrated experience as a Product Lead or Product Manager, preferably within B2C product domains
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to influence cross-functional stakeholders and simplify complex legal or technical topics.
* A mix of analytical ability, technical understanding, and business judgment — with the go-getter mindset of a “start-up CEO.”
* A strong track record of working with and coaching cross-functional teams, including engineers, data analysts, finance, legal, and ops.
* Experience building globally scalable systems that adapt to local market variations.


 Next Steps
   

  

 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**What We Should Tell You About The Company**
 Filed is building the
 **first AI tax preparer** 
 trusted by America’s accounting firms. This industry might seem boring—but it’s a $70B backbone of the economy that’s breaking under a talent shortage no one has solved. We’re fixing it—fast.
   

  

 In just 9 months, we’ve hit
 **strong product-market fit** 
 , are generating insanely
 **fast-growing, ridiculously sticky revenue** 
 , and are
 **backed by top-tier investors** 
 . We’re not a tool—we’re the missing workforce firms have been sounding the alarm for. We’re building the future with expanding our already 30 person team, with those who want to say
 **“I was there when it all started.”**
 https://techcrunch.com/2025/05/21/filed-raises-17m-to-automate-the-drudgery-of-tax-prep/
   

  

 ⸻
   

  

**What We Should Tell You About The Role**
 We’re looking for a full-stack engineer who moves fast and thrives in high-velocity environments. You’re the kind of person who sees a broken workflow, understands the root cause quickly, and ships a fix in hours—not weeks. You love turning ambiguity into working software, and you don’t wait around for perfect specs to start building.
   

  

 You’re a generalist who’s just as comfortable spinning up a backend service as you are crafting a clean, responsive UI. You sweat the details, but never let them block progress. You think in terms of speed, value, and iteration—always asking: how can we get this in front of users faster?
   

  

 As one of our earliest engineers, you’ll help shape the core product and infrastructure. You’ll work closely with design, ML, and actual tax pros to reinvent how this industry works by shipping fast, learning fast, and doing what others said couldn’t be done.
   

  

 Our product and engineering team is based in
 **Stockholm** 
 . We’re prioritising local candidates, but will
 **consider candidates from elsewhere in the EU, who can travel to Stockholm.**
 ⸻
   

  

**Here’s Why This Is a Terrible Job**
* This is not a job for someone who likes to move slow.
* We operate week to week with ruthless speed. Sometimes we’re going in the wrong direction, but more times than not we’re going in the right direction.
* If you need a few extra days to perfect your code, chances are there’s already a handful of team members blocked behind you.
* We use tools like Cursor to move fast, test ideas in days, and ship extremely fast.
* You’ll be operating at the intersection of product logic, machine learning, user psychology, and highly regulated workflows.
* There are no clear answers. Just judgment calls, ambiguity, and constant input from every direction.
* You’ll ask yourself, is this really the work? It is. And it’s not for everyone.


 ⸻
   

  

**Here's Why It's The Best Career Choice You'll Make**
* We’re building what tax pros call impossible. A product that behaves like a teammate, not just another tool.
* We run reviews every 4 months. We operate with total transparency around pay, performance, and progress.
* You’ll be paid above market. You’ll earn equity that grows fast. And you’ll have full autonomy to make high-impact decisions.
* You’ll ship code because you believe in it, not because it got signed off.
* You’ll talk to customers weekly. You’ll drive outcomes end to end.
* We’ll tell you what needs to be achieved. How you get there is on you.
* We expect you to build a customer Oracle. An internal simulator so dialed in that you can predict exactly what your user needs before you ever talk to them.
* That comes from immersion, curiosity, and care.


 ⸻
   

  

**The Teammate We're Looking For**
* Thrives at solving complex, technical product problems
* Moves seamlessly between systems thinking and detailed execution
* Excited by the challenge of serving multiple user groups and workflows
* No lone wolves — we need a collaborative engineer
* Big bonus if you have a track record of owning product outcomes, not just tasks


 ⸻
   

  

**What You’ll Be Responsible For**
* Architecting and building complex workflows across the full stack
* Co-owning the entire product experience from backend to frontend
* Driving product direction through technical execution and intuition
* Becoming an Oracle with a best-in-class customer model in your head


 ⸻
   

  

**Your Hard Skillset**
* Deep experience across backend and frontend systems
* Fluency in TypeScript, Python, or similar modern stacks
* Comfortable with infra, APIs, databases, and debugging messy edge cases
* Bonus if you’ve used AI tools to accelerate development
* Even bigger bonus if you’ve worked in regulated or high-trust domains


 ⸻
   

  

**Your Soft Skillset**
* Comfortable being uncomfortable and making calls with incomplete data
* Empathetic and curious — building for the user, not just for elegance
* Highly collaborative across product, design, and customer support
* Detail-oriented but pragmatic — you know when polish matters and when to move
* You own your work and welcome the accountability that comes with it


 ⸻
   

  

**Growth And Levels**
 We operate on six levels, from Level 1 to Level 6. Each reflects increasing ownership, impact, and scope with meaningful jumps in salary and equity.
   

  

 We review levels every 4 months. Promotions are based on output and ownership, not tenure.
   

  

 This isn’t a comfy engineering role. It’s fast, focused, and customer-obsessed.
   

  

 You will build fast. You will learn fast. You will own what you ship.
   

  

 ⸻
   

  

**The Process**
* Quick intro call (30 minutes)
* Code walkthrough and async task (60 minutes)
* Final round with our team (120 minutes)


 In just 3.5 hours, you’ll be wanting early access, just like the rest of our team—to dive into the codebase and help build a generational company, even before you start as you'll be able to see the opportunity to transform your career.
   

  

 Compensation Range: $66K - $143K

title: Client Executive
description:
Are you interested in working for an international company with high-performing colleagues and international clients? Marsh AB is now looking for a Client Executive to join our Corporate team. This role is for you who enjoy working with sales and customer relationships. At Marsh, you will have the opportunity to influence the company’s operations, develop professionally, and become part of a team with competent and inspiring colleagues in an international environment.
   

  

**About the role:**
 The responsibilities include taking full ownership of your clients and developing the business with them where you see potential to broaden or deepen it. You manage and develop the clients, ensure they receive the best solutions, and you have an underlying profitability responsibility. The right service to the right client. You also have an interest in meeting new companies and contributing to expanding Marsh’s client portfolio. You work both administratively and communicatively and build and maintain strong working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
   

  

**Examples of tasks include:**
* Assisting our clients with relevant advice regarding risk and insurance
* Conducting strategic dialogues with the contact person, often the CEO or CFO
* Leading projects and being the coordinating contact towards the client
* Delivering services personally, but also having the ability to project manage specialists and risk engineers performing work for the client
* Identifying new business opportunities with your clients and proactively working to broaden Marsh’s business
* Contacting new potential clients


**We are looking for someone who:**
* Has 3+ years of experience in a similar role
* Preferably holds an academic degree in law, economics, or engineering
* Has good communication skills
* Is structured, meets deadlines, and can handle multiple tasks simultaneously
* Values service and always puts the client first
* Enjoys working independently but also finds collaboration rewarding
* To thrive at Marsh, we believe you are attracted to being part of a large, global organization and find insurance an interesting field


**We offer you:**
* To become part of a great team with competent colleagues and a positive work climate
* A varied role with great potential for significant personal responsibility
* Many different points of contact, both internally and externally
* For the right person, there are great development opportunities within the role
* Location in central Stockholm
* A permanent position with a start date by agreement


 Marsh, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), is the world’s top insurance broker and risk advisor. Marsh McLennan is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. With annual revenue of $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit marsh.com, or follow on LinkedIn and X.
   

  

 Marsh McLennan is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
   

  

 Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person.
   

  

**R\_326982**

title: Scala Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* 5–8 years of backend development experience
* Strong knowledge of Scala and functional programming (Scala is a must have)
* Experience working in microservices architectures
* Familiarity with agile/Scrum workflows
* Good communication and collaboration skills


**Meritorious**
* Background in Java or similar languages
* Experience with Svelte (front-end exposure)


**Application deadline: 19-11-2025**
**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Masters Student
description:
**Background** 




 The Mycronic Pattern Generator division develops high-precision mask writers used for manufacturing advanced photomasks in the semiconductor and display industries. These photomasks are used globally, providing cutting-edge production solutions for high-resolution displays and semiconductor chips. Almost all displays you see around you; TV:s, computers, tablets, mobile phones etc. are manufactured using our technology.
 



  





 Achieving the required nanometer-level accuracy in these machines places high demands on the motion control and metrology systems. To meet these demands, several complementary sensors are used to measure and control motion. By combining their data using sensor fusion or multi-sensor estimation techniques, it may be possible to obtain a more robust and comprehensive estimate of the system’s motion state. This thesis will explore and evaluate such methods for potential use in Mycronic’s precision motion systems.
 



  





**Objective** 




 The goal of this thesis is to design, implement, and evaluate a sensor fusion framework that combines encoder, interferometer, and accelerometer data to improve position estimation in precision motion control. The specific objectives are to:
 


1. Conduct a literature study of sensor fusion methods for precision mechatronic systems (e.g. Extended/Unscented Kalman Filters, complementary filters).
2. Model sensor behavior and key error sources (bias drift, noise, scale factors, alignment, environmental effects).
3. Develop and implement a sensor fusion algorithm in MATLAB, Python or C.
4. Evaluate its performance using simulated and/or measured data from Mycronic’s metrology systems.
5. Analyze accuracy, robustness, and dynamic performance compared to single-sensor approaches.



  





**Scope** 




 The work focuses on modeling, algorithm design, and data analysis. Hardware design or new sensor development is not included. The student(s) will, however, have access to real sensor data and laboratory equipment for testing and validation.
 



  





**Requirements** 




 We are looking for one or two motivated master’s students with a background in Mechatronics, Control Systems, Electrical Engineering, Engineering Physics, or equivalent disciplines.
 



**Start date for the thesis work:** 
 To be agreed upon with the selected candidates.
 



 Estimated time required per candidate: 30 ECTS
 



  





**Contact** 




 Andreas Bergström, Manager, andreas.bergström@mycronic.com, +46 (0)728 541 748
 



 Samuel Eriksson, Mechatronics Engineer, samuel.eriksson@mycronic.com, +46 (0)701 461 474

title: Embedded & Prototyping Engineer
description:
*Natural Cycles° is a leading women’s health company that developed the world’s first birth control app, used by millions globally. We are a fast growing startup, and we promote an international working environment filled with smart and ambitious colleagues based in Stockholm, Geneva, New York, and remotely. Our mission is to pioneer women’s health through research and passion, empowering every woman with the knowledge she needs to take charge of her health.* 




  





 We’re looking for an engineer who loves building things end-to-end, someone who lives in firmware but isn’t afraid to pick up a soldering iron, spin a test jig, or open Xcode to verify an app integration.
 



  





 You’ll work directly with the Head of Hardware to prototype, test, and refine the next generation of wearable devices, bridging firmware, hardware, and app layers. You’ll be encouraged to generate code and move fast to explore ideas or solve problems.
 



  





 If you’re motivated by curiosity and iteration, and want to work across the stack from firmware optimization to app development and data analysis, this is an opportunity to do exactly that.
 



  





**Please note that we are hiring for this role in Stockholm, Sweden.** 




  





**What you will be doing** 




 You’ll be hands-on across several active hardware programs, supporting:
 



**Firmware Development & Optimization** 



* Implement and improve sensor drivers, data collection, and low-power algorithms
* Maintain and improve BLE communication, background updates (FOTA), and data transfer
* Customize and structure raw logs for testing and analytics
* Debug firmware plugins and integrate analytics for data validation
* Profile and reduce battery consumption across operating modes



**Hardware Prototyping & Validation** 



* Perform hardware modifications and assist in sensor integration or board validation
* Contribute to test setups for endurance, temperature, and performance validation
* Support design iterations (materials, ergonomics, assembly feedback)
* Participate in certification and compliance efforts



**App & Tooling Collaboration** 



* Use code generation tools to develop, extend or debug iOS and Android apps
* Prototype app-side visualizations
* Collaborate with software engineers to verify firmware to app data flows
* Contribute to automation and data validation pipelines when needed



  





**What skills and experience we think you have** 



* 3 to 5 years of experience and a strong background in embedded systems, firmware, or electrical engineering
* Proficiency in C/C++ and familiarity with ARM-based MCUs (e.g., nRF52, STM32, CC2642)
* Experience with BLE, sensor interfacing (I²C/SPI), and low-power design
* Comfort with hardware tools (oscilloscope, soldering, basic rework, or prototype bring-up)
* Interest in using AI-assisted development tools (Cursor, Copilot, etc.) for both firmware and app experiments
* A practical, experimental mindset you test ideas early, measure results, and iterate fast



  





**Bonus Points** 



* Familiarity with data analysis and app analytics
* Experience with Swift (iOS), Kotlin (Android), or cross-platform frameworks like Ionic or React Native
* Exposure to temperature or optical sensing systems
* Understanding of wearable power management and BLE stack tuning
* Curiosity about digital health, female physiology, or biometric sensing



  





**Why You’ll Love It Here** 



* Work directly with Natural Cycles’ Head of Hardware on wearable development
* Freedom to experiment from firmware to hardware to app-level
* Use modern tools and do real-world R&D with a clear objectives and goals
* Be part of a small, deeply technical team where ideas move fast and impact is tangible



  





**Location** 




 We are remote-friendly, but we find great value in connecting in person. For this role, you’ll collaborate closely with our Head of Hardware, who is based in Stockholm.
 



 Not living in Sweden? No problem! We offer relocation support to help you move.
 



  





**Sounds interesting?** 




 If you want to be part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position as soon as possible. We look forward to hearing from you!
 



  





**How to apply** 




 To apply, just upload your CV and answer the questions on the application form. Keep in mind that we can't accept applications through email because of GDPR, and only applications submitted via the career site (and in English) will be considered.
 



  





 At Natural Cycles we value diversity and inclusion because we know that teams with people from different backgrounds and experiences are stronger. We welcome candidates from all walks of life and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.
 



  





  





**Note: We are not looking for consultants or help from recruitment agencies**

title: Systems Architect – Ground Systems
description:
**Job Description**
 Welcome to SSC – Swedish Space Corporation, the perfect workplace for those passionate about technology in general and space in particular.
   

  

 With space organizations, research institutes, institutional and commercial actors as customers, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications, space consulting services, rocket and balloon systems, flight test services, satellite propulsion systems, and much more.
   

  

 SSC also has one of the world’s largest global networks of ground stations for satellite communications. We own and operate the Esrange Space Center in Kiruna,
   

  

 northern Sweden, with the aim of launching satellites in the near future.
   

  

**Are you passionate about space exploration?**
**Do you want to play a critical role in enabling** 
**communication for** 
**missions around Earth, and beyond?** 

 If you answer yes to these questions, we invite you to seize the opportunity to make a significant impact as our Systems Architect for Ground Station as a Service solutions to provide domain expertise to existing and future solutions.
   

  

**Job Requirements**
 YOUR ROLE
   

  

 As a System Architect, you will play a central role in defining and evolving the architecture and features of our global ground segment services covering both software and hardware systems. You will ensure that our systems are robust, interoperable, and ready to meet the demands of the rapidly changing space industry.
   

  

**In This Role, You Will**
* Define, initiate development, and improve the architecture of end-to-end ground segment services, integrating both software and hardware systems.
* Be a technical leader and provider of domain expertise for satellite communications and spacecraft operations domain topics.
* Lead and coordinate technical activities involving multiple teams and disciplines.
* Contribute to system-level analyses, reviews, and improvement initiatives in collaboration with other teams.
* Support bids and projects with technical expertise.


**Job Responsibilities**
 WHO YOU ARE
   

  

 We are looking for candidates who combine deep technical knowledge with strong systems thinking and expertise in ground systems for spacecraft communications and/or spacecraft operations.
   

  

**You Likely Have**
* A university degree in electrical engineering, space technology, or a related field.
* Experience and strong interest in spacecraft communications and/or spacecraft operations.
* Excellent communication skills, able to translate complex system concepts to diverse audiences.
* A structured and pragmatic mindset, focused on achieving operational reliability and long-term excellence.


**We Especially Value Experience In**
* CCSDS standards (for example TM/TC, SLE, CFDP, DTN) in operational or development contexts.
* TT&C systems, including baseband processing, data reception chains, and ground station interfaces.
* RF systems and link analysis (modulation, coding, spectrum usage, link budgets).
* Orbit dynamics or mission design concepts.


**Job Benefits**
 WE OFFER YOU
   

  

* A unique opportunity to contribute to a wide range of projects and play an active role in both the Swedish and international space industry.
* An excellent opportunity for personal and career development.
* An exciting, international workplace characterized by an open atmosphere and proud employees all over the world.


 Additional benefits
   

  

* In addition to vacation and traditional public holidays, we offer extra paid leave throughout the year, such as time off between Christmas and New Year, Ascension Day, amounting to 6-11 extra days depending on the calendar.
* Wellness allowance of SEK 5,000 per year.
* Health benefits such as voluntary health insurance and regular health checks for eligible employees.
* Access to a benefit bike through a tax-efficient leasing program.
* Support for employee-driven activities that promote connection, health, and culture across teams.
* Collective Agreement, including good pensions plans, parental pay and insurance.


  

  

 LOCATION
   

  

 This is a full-time, permanent position based at our office in either Solna or Kiruna.
   

  

 FURTHER INFORMATION
   

  

 For questions regarding the position, you are welcome to contact:
   

  

 Petrus Hyvönen, Head of Engineering (petrus.hyvonen@sscspace.com)
   

  

 For questions regarding employment terms or union-related matters, you are welcome to contact our union representatives:
   

  

 Sveriges Ingenjörer: SverigesIngenjorer-AF@sscspace.com
   

  

 Unionen: unionen@sscspace.com
   

  

  

  

 NEXT STEP
   

  

 If this opportunity sparks your interest, don’t wait to apply! Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis, and interviews will be conducted continuously. We kindly ask you to submit your CV when applying. While you are welcome to include a brief personal note or letter, our evaluation will primarily focus on your skills and qualifications as outlined in your CV, ensuring a fair and unbiased recruitment process.
   

  

 Please note that the job advertisement may close earlier than the stated deadline if we receive a high volume of applications. This allows us to ensure a fair and efficient recruitment process and give each application the attention it deserves.
   

  

 This is a security-classified position and will require a background check prior to employment.
   

  

 We welcome your application no later than 2025-12-01.
   

  

 WE HELP EARTH BENEFIT FROM SPACE
   

  

 Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) is a leading global provider of advanced space services, with more than 50 years of experience. We help space organizations, research institutes, commercial and institutional actors from all over the world to get access to space.
   

  

 With local presence on all continents and about 700 committed employees, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications and satellite control services, spacecraft operations, rocket and balloon systems, launch services and flight test services, as well as engineering, operations and consultancy services for space missions.
   

  

 We help Earth benefit from Space. Learn more at sscspace.com

title: Områdesarkitekt till avdelningen Myndighetsgemensam IT
description:
Har du erfarenhet av att navigera komplexa IT-landskap och översätta långsiktiga verksamhetsbehov till strategisk IT? Som områdesarkitekt hos Arbetsförmedlingen får du en central roll i att utveckla och stödja myndighetens förflyttning till en digital och modern verksamhet. Med din erfarenhet inom arkitektur och strategiskt perspektiv blir du en nyckelperson i arbetet med målarkitektur och effektiva processer.
   

  

*Tillsammans får vi Sverige i arbete. Vill du bli en av oss?*
**Avdelningens uppdrag**
 Myndighetsgemensam IT ansvarar för ett varierat och komplext tekniskt landskap som stödjer myndighetens gemensamma funktioner, såsom ekonomi, inköp, rättsfrågor, dokumenthantering, HR och kommunikation. Genom våra produkter och byggstenar bidrar vi till att öka myndighetens inre effektivitet, med fokus på att förenkla och förbättra för alla medarbetare på myndigheten.
   

  

**Områdesarkitektens uppdrag och ansvar**
 Till avdelningen Myndighetsgemensam söker vi nu en områdesarkitekt med bred teknisk kunskap och erfarenhet av strategisk verksamhetsutveckling genom IT. Vi befinner oss i en spännande transformationsresa där vi förflyttar både verksamheten och systemlandskapet mot mer standardisering och effektiva arbetssätt. Som områdesarkitekt är du en del av arbetsförmedlingens arkitekturstyrning och blir en nyckelperson i utvecklingen av målarkitektur och gemensamma arkitekturprinciper som stödjer myndighetens digitala transformation.
   

  

 Du kommer i första hand att arbeta med övergripande arkitekturella frågor inom ekonomi och inköpsområdet där det finns ett komplext systemlandskap med många beroenden och intressenter. Vårt landskap innehåller standardsystem såväl som egenutvecklade lösningar och det finns ett behov av att modernisera och anpassa landskapet för att även framgent möta vår myndighets behov. Rollen kräver förmåga att främst arbeta på taktisk och strategisk nivå.
   

  

 Du fungerar som en länk mellan IT avdelningens transformationskontor och våra produktteam i frågor rörande teknisk arkitektur och anpassar arkitekturkoncept med verksamhetens behov i beaktande. Du har mycket god förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och tillsammans med andra, planerar och driver arbetet framåt för att nå resultat på ett prestigelöst sätt.
   

  

 Har du bred erfarenhet av arkitekturarbete i stora organisationer och kan peka ut arkitekturell riktning i samklang med långsiktiga verksamhetsbehov? Då kan du vara precis den vi söker.
   

  

**Vårt erbjudande**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid som kan komma att inledas med sex månaders provanställning. Placeringsorten är Solna.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder dig möjligheten att arbeta på en arbetsplats där vi värdesätter balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Du får tillgång till ett generöst semesteravtal, flexibla arbetstider samt möjlighet att arbeta på distans upp till 49 procent på årsbasis. Hos oss ingår även friskvård under arbetstid och ett förmånligt friskvårdsbidrag.
   

  

 Som anställd på Arbetsförmedlingen har du också tillgång till kompetensutveckling och karriärmöjligheter inom myndigheten. Genom vårt arbete bidrar vi till ett inkluderande och hållbart samhälle, där du får möjlighet att göra en verklig skillnad för individer och för samhället i stort.
   

  

 Mer om att jobba hos oss
   

  

**Grundläggande krav för tjänsten**
* Högskoleexamen, minst 180 hp (120 p enligt tidigare system) inom systemvetenskap alternativt högskoleingenjör eller civilingenjör inom relevanta områden, eller motsvarande kompetens/erfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig
* Flerårig aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete som domänarkitekt, områdesarkitekt, senior lösningsarkitekt eller motsvarande
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig på svenska både muntligt och skriftligt


**Övriga meriter för tjänsten**
* Flerårig erfarenhet från taktiskt/strategiskt arkitekturarbete i komplexa systemlandskap med en blandning av standardplattformar och egenutvecklade lösningar
* Certifiering inom IT-arkitektur, verksamhetsarkitektur eller informationsarkitektur
* Erfarenhet av arbete med ERP-/ekonomilösningar
* Erfarenhet av arbete med verksamhetsarkitektur


 Den statliga värdegrunden guidar oss i vårt dagliga arbete. Som anställd hos oss förväntas du arbeta rättvist, opartiskt och med hög integritet, samt bidra till att upprätthålla och stärka förtroendet för vår myndighet.
   

  

 Mer om statliga värdegrunden
   

  

 Utöver dessa kvalifikationer har du personlig förmåga och fallenhet att arbeta i enlighet med Arbetsförmedlingens medarbetarskap:
   

  

 Medarbetare på Arbetsförmedlingen:
   

  

* Tar ansvar för sina arbetsprestationer och sitt bidrag till helheten
* Anpassar sig till förändring och oförutsedda händelser
* Tar initiativ till utveckling och bidrar till förbättring


**Ansökan**
 Låter det här som en tjänst för dig? Välkommen med din ansökan senast
 **2025-11-16** 
 . I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Experis. Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta

title: Field Sales
description:
**Job Description**
**Reshape How We Win in the Independent Software Vendors (ISV) Ecosystem**
 At Nexi, we're revolutionizing how payment solutions integrate into the software that powers businesses across Europe. As part of our
 **ISV Field Sales** 
 team, you'll spearhead our next phase of growth in the Integrated Software Vendor space, bringing our innovative solutions to directly to merchants.
   

  

 This is about getting close to small businesses, helping them understand how our innovative partnerships can accelerate their growth and supporting them through the full sales cycle. It’s the perfect role for a high energy, success-driven software salesperson who thrives on face-to-face contact.
   

  

**The Challenge**
 The ISV landscape is evolving rapidly. We have partnerships across Europe with innovative providers, integrating payments into their market-leading commercial products. Now we need to take those product solutions to small and medium sized businesses across Europe, build compelling business cases to solve their problems, and supporting them through the whole sales and onboarding cycle.
   

  

 You'll be identifying and acquiring new customers while working in a busy, international environment with plenty of room for growth
   

  

**Your Mission**
**Hunt and Win ISV customers**
* Identify and engage high-potential customers in the target sectors
* Build compelling sales cases that demonstrate the value of our solutions
* Manage sales process from initial contact through successful onboarding and go live


**Drive Commercial & Technical Partnership Success**
* Develop deep understanding of ISV business models, technical requirements, and integration capabilities
* Collaborate with technical and onboarding teams to ensure seamless onboarding experiences


**Support Partnership Approach**
* Provide market intelligence that shapes our ISV strategy and product development


**Own Revenue Growth**
* Own your revenue targets and growth objectives


**What We're Looking For**
**Partnership Hunter Mindset**
* Revenue Driver: You're motivated by targets and understand how partnerships translate to business growth
* Relationship Builder: You earn trust quickly and maintain mutually beneficial relationships with a real focus on customer success
* Market Challenger: You're comfortable competing and winning in a complex technical market


**Technical & Commercial Expertise**
* Software Sales Experience: Proven track record in B2B software or SaaS sales
* Technical Fluency: Comfortable discussing technical integration requirements with customers, in clear and compelling terms, and collaborating with stakeholders across internal technical functions


**Sales Excellence**
* Track record of achieving revenue targets


**Life at Nexi**
 Discover more about us and what it's like to be part of Nexi by visiting this page: https://www.nexigroup.com/en/people/life-at-nexi/overview/?utm\_source=career-platform&utm\_medium=job-openings&utm\_content=standard .
   

  

 Learn about our values, meet our communities, and see how we are shaping the future of digital payments together.
   

  

**Apply now!**
 If this opportunity resonates with you, we'd love to hear from you!
   

  

 Please apply at your earliest convenience. We'll be reviewing applications continuously and closing the position once we've found the right fit. We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong.
   

  

 By exploring this job opening, you're one step closer to joining us. We're excited to learn more about you!
   

  

**About Us**
 Are you interested in joining one of Europe's leading PayTech companies?
   

  

 Do you want to be part of a diverse team, collaborating with colleagues from across Europe? If so, you're in the right place!

title: Infrastructure Architect, Management Access - Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
As of 2 September 2025, Tietoevry Tech Services, earlier part of Tietoevry Group, will operate as a standalone company. We'll soon be operating under a new name:
 **Vivicta** 
 . You will discover more about our new brand by the end of the year. Read more.
   

  

 You may apply by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.
   

  

 Vi söker en teknisk infrastrukturarkitekt med erfarenhet av servermiljöer samt Management Access/Privileged Access Management (MA/PAM). Har du dessutom kunskap inom virtualisering, nätverk eller klienthantering är det ett stort plus.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du att ansvara för att designa, implementera och förvalta MA/PAM-lösningar för att skydda vår information. Du kommer att samarbeta med olika team för att säkerställa att vår infrastruktur för åtkomsthantering är användarvänlig, säker och uppfyller moderna branschstandarder.
   

  

**När du börjar på Tietoevry Tech Services som infrastrukturarkitekt kommer du att**
* Utvärdera befintlig infrastruktur och rekommendera förbättringar eller uppgraderingar.
* Designa, implementera och underhåll MA/PAM-lösningar för att möta organisationens säkerhetsbehov.
* Samarbeta med kundteam, lösnings-, säkerhets- och regelefterlevnadsteam för att etablera och upprätthålla åtkomstpolicyer och rutiner.
* Möjliggöra implementering och integration av verktyg och teknologier.
* Övervaka effektiviteten i åtkomstkontroller och gör nödvändiga justeringar för att förbättra säkerhetsnivån och andra funktioner.
* Ge expertvägledning och stöd vid lösning av komplexa säkerhetsrelaterade infrastrukturproblem.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste trenderna och utvecklingen inom teknik och cybersäkerhet i stort.


**Vem vi söker**
 Vi söker dig som har ett genuint intresse för cybersäkerhet och säkra miljöer. Du har god förståelse för principer, standarder och bästa praxis inom området, och trivs med att lösa komplexa problem – även under press. Din kommunikativa förmåga och starka samarbetsförmåga gör att du enkelt bygger relationer och arbetar effektivt tillsammans med andra team.
   

  

**Vi tror att du har minst ett av följande kriterium.**
* God förståelse för hantering av servrar och arbetsstationer, samt starka färdigheter inom design, planering och konfiguration av säkra infrastrukturlösningar.
* 2+ års erfarenhet av IT-arkitektur, inklusive arbete med lösningar för Management Access och Privileged Access Management i en större företagsmiljö.
* Erfarenhet av licenshantering och arbete i Active Directory (AD)-miljöer är också meriterande.


**Det är meriterande om du har**
* Erfarenhet av Juniper-produkter.
* Certifieringar inom ovan nämnda teknologier.


**Rollen kräver förmåga att tala och skriva obehindrat på svenska, samt svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning kommer att genomföras på slutkandidat.**
**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Vi erbjuder dig professionell tillväxt, meningsfulla projekt, öppen kultur och en enastående balans mellan arbete och privatliv! Vi erbjuder dig en möjlighet att skapa framtiden för en snabbt växande och viktig sektor. Vi tror att vår organisationskultur är en viktig del för att du ska bli framgångsrik. Vi tillhandahåller en flexibel hybrid arbetsmodell som en del av vår kultur och vårt sätt att arbeta. Slutligen tror vi också på nyfikenhet och konstant lärande som en livsstil där du behöver skola om dig varje dag när nya möjligheter dyker upp.
   

  

 Blev du inspirerad?
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Bifoga ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil så kontaktar vi dig. Intervjuer kommer att hållas löpande, så vi uppmanar dig att söka redan idag. Om du har några frågor angående denna roll, vänligen kontakta anställande chef, Jarkko Kentala, jarkko.kentala@tietoevry.com
   

  

 Hoppas vi hörs snart!
   

  

 Plats: Stockholm/Örebro/Malmö (Hybrid)
   

  

*Vi utför bakgrundskontroller av alla slutkandidater.*
*Tietoevry tackar nej till samtal från rekryteringsföretag.*
**Om Tietoevry Tech Services**
 Tietoevry Tech Services är en ledande leverantör av transformations- och IT-drifttjänster, med fokus på nordiska privata och offentliga kunder inom olika branscher.
   

  

 Med vårt kompletta utbud av digitala lösningar – inklusive applikationer, multicloud, data & AI samt säkerhetstjänster – hjälper vi företag att utvecklas och håller de nordiska samhällena i gång.
   

  

 Vi är ett globalt team med över 7 000 experter från mer än 50 nationaliteter och levererar tjänster till våra kunder genom att kombinera globala kapabiliteter med nordisk närhet. Ledd av våra värderingar – jämlikhet, transparens och tillit – strävar vi efter att vara den bästa möjliga arbetsplatsen.
   

  

 Nu söker vi talangfulla personer som vill följa med oss på vår spännande resa mot att bli ett självständigt bolag och tillsammans forma det digitala landskapet i Norden.

title: Principal AI/ML Engineer
description:
**Craft:**
 Data, Analytics & Strategy
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Principal AI/ML Engineer – Operable Level Ecosystem**
**Job Description**
 Do you have a dynamic approach to solving Machine Learning problems at scale? Are you passionate about building machine learning (ML) tools for level designers? Do you believe machine learning (ML) can have a material impact on how we do business and want to be a part of the journey to help teams, company wide, enhance our players’ experiences? Then you could be our new, shiny, Principal AI/ML Engineer!
   

  

**Your role within our Kingdom**
 You´ll be part of a team in Shared Tech Game Operations department. Working alongside Level Designers and Game Developers to develop and scale ML models that enhance level creation and optimization across multiple games. Our mission? To drive innovation in AI-powered level design, automate playtesting, and advance procedural content generation, enabling faster, smarter, and more engaging game experiences. As part of this, you will contribute empowering game teams with
 **targeted AI-driven automation tools, real-time analytics, and workflow optimization** 
 to improve efficiency and enhance game design processes.
   

  

 As a Principal AI/ML Engineer at King, you will be using the latest technologies to build ML products that empowers game design workflows across the company. With over 250+ million monthly active users and 50 billion events being uploaded daily, it’s key that you care about ML methodologies and latest ML advancements. You’ll be working with both tabular and non-tabular data, directly integrated in our products, in a highly ambitious technical environment.
   

  

**Skills To Create Thrills**
 So, what about you? You are part of a Shared Tech Levels team, and you’re an advocate of data storytelling. You’re also passionate for building ML-powered features that accelerates the level creation and operations ecosystem. You also have experience in some of the following areas:
   

  

* Statistical Analysis
* Building data pipelines and ML pipelines
* GCP data products (VertexAI, BigQuery, Cloud Storage, Dataflow, to name a few) or products from other cloud providers
* Familiar with TensorFlow or PyTorch
* ML model and ML product Monitoring
* Software Engineering skills
* Development in or exposure to environments/software products in Python
