* Team up with our architect and data engineers to further improve the user experience, drive automation and make sure we apply state-of-the-art technologies.
* Join the team of data engineers and partner-up to design and implement new use cases from data source to report layer. We work with top-notch technologies like Snowflake, Matillion, Python and infrastructure tools like Terraform, Docker, and Kubernetes.
* Take responsibility to ensure continuous operations of the data warehouse across all domains. I.e. ensure daily processes run smoothly and data is readily accessible for all users.
* Enjoy a high degree of self-responsibility and the possibility to expand your expertise towards areas of your interest.


**Qualifications**
**Your profile**
* Pro-active, self-driven team player with excellent communication skills and a broad interest across all technical domains is a must-have in this position.
* At least three years hands-on experience in designing, implementing, and maintaining scalable data solutions using Microsoft Azure cloud services. During this time, you were in the lead to develop and maintain DevOps build and release pipelines using e.g. Git.
* Sound practical experience with cloud infrastructure troubleshooting and understanding of networking components.
* Good hands-on experience with application containerization into Kubernetes, managing Kubernetes namespaces and containers, and experience with managing VM infrastructure.
* Comfortable maintaining, patching and configuring both Linux and Windows servers as admin. Proficiency with the scripting languages Python and Bash as well as with Linux will be required. Knowledge of Powershell would be a merit.
* Experience with infrastructure provisioning and deployment using Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) tools like Terraform.
* University degree in Business and Information Technology, Engineering or other related fields and fluent in English, written and spoken.


**As a merit you also have**
* Experience with implementing observability best practices - logging, monitoring, and alerting using tools like Grafana, Prometheus, or Azure monitor.
* It would ease your transition into the data engineering part of this role if you have hands-on experience with SQL based data modelling in a cloud data warehouse-environment. Previous experience with data orchestration tools, e.g. Matillion or Airflow will further simplify your onboarding.


 Additional Information
   

  

 We welcome your application in English, no later than
 **18th of November 2025** 
 . We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website as we cannot guarantee that we will be able to process applications that are not made via our website.
   

  

 For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our Recruiter
 **Jil Ungethüm** 
 via phone at +49 40 79022 1378.
   

  

 At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation.
   

  

 The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfill within Vattenfall. The screening will be performed by a third party, called DISA. In addition, a certificate of good conduct (i.e. criminal record certificate) is required for certain positions.
   

  

 The trade union representatives in Sweden can be reached via Vattenfall´s switchboard +46 8 739 50 00. Sven-Gunnar Gremlin, Akademikerna and Anders Bohlin, Unionen.
   

  

 Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
**Company Description**
**Vattenfall** 
 is a European energy company with approximately 21.000 employees. For more than 100 years we have electrified industries, supplied energy to people’s homes and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation. We are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their own role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission.
   

  

 Right in the heart of Vattenfall, at
 **Business Area (BA) Markets** 
 , you will find an inspiring international environment, with a culture of care and personal growth, enabling you to be who you are, having fun, building strong relationships and learning every day. Find out what our colleagues think about our culture: https://youtu.be/-9qGrDUCptA
   

  

 We employ around 500 professionals who are active across Europe with offices in Sweden, Germany, The Netherlands, and the United Kingdom to drive the energy transition together. Our role in Vattenfall is to maximize the value of the overall portfolio by optimizing and dispatching, hedging, and sourcing for Vattenfall's sales and generation volumes. We serve as Vattenfall’s single access to energy commodity markets and trade electricity, emissions, fuels, freight, and renewable certificates.
   

  

 In BA Markets the mission of the
 **Unit OU Operations** 
 is to drive the digital transformation. OU Operations consists of diverse and highly skilled employees from more than 20 countries. We work internationally from our locations in Stockholm, Hamburg and Amsterdam.

title: Integrationsutvecklare MuleSoft
emails: matilda.sandring@skatteverket.se, tomas.stjernholm@skatteverket.se, christina.lindstrup@skatteverket.se, jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, therese.sjodin@skatteverket.se
description:
Brinner du för integrationsutveckling? Vi söker nu Integrationsutvecklare med helhetsansvar för integrationslösningar som bidrar till ett fungerande samhälle. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Som Integrationsutvecklare hos oss arbetar du i ett tvärfunktionellt agilt utvecklingsteam där ni tillsammans ansvarar för teamets leveranser samtidigt som ni ser till helheten. Du är med och tillgängliggör Skatteverket och vår information i kundens val av miljö och tar fram lösningar som gör det möjligt för medborgare att utnyttja våra e-tjänster. Tillsammans i teamet organiserar ni arbetet och det finns goda möjligheter att fördjupa sig inom olika områden. Vi har ett strategiskt viktigt uppdrag och satsar på hållbara, framtidssäkra lösningar - alltid med samhällsnyttan i fokus.
   

  

 Du blir en nyckelperson i att från ax till limpa utveckla robusta och säkra integrationslösningar. Primärt arbetar du med realtidsintegrationer genom API lösningar (REST) och vår tekniska plattform är MuleSoft Anypoint. Våra batchintegrationer bygger vi på Informatica Powercenter. Vi organiserar oss genom SAFe ramverket och utvecklingsmiljön omfattar även Java, Red Hat OpenShift, Linux, Kubernetes, Docker, Mulesoft, Informatica och Spring Boot.
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet till ständig utveckling och lärande i arbetet. Vi jobbar aktivt med kompetens och teknikutveckling genom exempelvis innovationssprintar. Tack vare att vi är en stor it-organisation kan vi erbjuda goda möjligheter till intern rörlighet och du kan utveckla både bredd och spets hos oss.
   

  

 Skatteverkets it-avdelning arbetar aktivt för att främja en inkluderande arbetsplats som präglas av jämställdhet och mångfald där alla medarbetare får lika möjligheter att bidra och utvecklas. Läs mer på Jobba med it hos oss
   

  

 Din placeringsort är Sundbyberg.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* ha god samarbetsförmåga, vara hjälpsam och ha ett gott bemötande
* ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker, vara flexibel och öppen för förändringar
* ha god problemlösningsförmåga, se mönster och kunna göra avgränsningar
* vara målfokuserad och bidra till att syftet med verksamheten uppnås
* agera medvetet och professionellt utifrån en god självinsikt
* uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska.


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* relevant högskole-/universitetsutbildning inom it eller teknik alternativt motsvarande aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet
* flerårig aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet som Integrationsutvecklare inom MuleSoft Anypoint plattformen


**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/898 | Kontakt: Matilda Sandring, hr-specialist matilda.sandring@skatteverket.se, Tomas Stjernholm, rekryterande chef tomas.stjernholm@skatteverket.se, Christina Lindstrup, rekryterande chef christina.lindstrup@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, Therese Sjödin, Seko therese.sjodin@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2025-11-12 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-12-02

title: Full-Stack Cloud Engineer
description:
At Scania Industrial Batteries, we design and build advanced battery systems for off-road machines - and the digital ecosystem that connects them. From our R&D hub in
 **Solna, Sweden** 
 , and production site in
 **Gdańsk, Poland** 
 , we create cloud platforms and data services that turn battery and machine data into real-time insight, automation, and performance. Our technology powers the electrification of heavy industries such as mining, construction, and marine - transforming how energy is used in some of the world’s toughest environments.
 



  





 We are now looking for an experienced
 **Full-Stack Cloud Engineer** 
 to join our Software Engineering team.
 



  





 In this role, you’ll design, build, and operate distributed cloud services that connect our batteries and edge systems to data-driven applications. You’ll work across the stack - from infrastructure and backend services to data workflows and integrations - creating the backbone that connects cloud, edge, and hardware. You’ll collaborate closely with Cloud, Data, Edge, and Embedded Engineers to deliver secure, scalable, and production-grade solutions on AWS. Your daily work will include developing APIs and backend services in Go or another statically typed language, automating infrastructure using Terraform and containerized environments, and building reliable data pipelines for analytics and predictive insight. You’ll take part in architecture decisions, contribute to CI/CD and observability, and ensure our platform remains resilient, maintainable, and future-proof.
 



 We asked some of your future colleagues what makes this role stand out. It was hard for them to keep the list short, but they want to highlight that software at Scania Industrial Batteries interacts with real hardware in real industrial environments, enabling an electrified off-road industry - and that you’ll influence architecture across cloud, data, and edge systems. How cool is that? You don’t want to miss this opportunity!
 



  





**Skills & Requirements** 




 We are looking for someone with
 


* Extensive experience building distributed cloud platforms.
* Hands-on experience designing, deploying, and operating solutions on AWS.
* Proficiency in Go (or another statically typed language such as Java or C#).
* Experience with Databricks/Spark or similar data processing platforms, plus comfort with data workflows (SQL/ETL/ELT).
* Experience with Terraform/IaC, CI/CD pipelines, and containerization (Docker/Kubernetes).
* Ability to troubleshoot complex issues and collaborate effectively in a fast-paced, international environment.
* Excellent English skills, both written and spoken.



  





 It's an advantage if you have
 


* Experience building
 
 desktop apps (Electron, Tauri, or similar).
* Exposure to embedded/IoT systems, telemetry, or real-time data flows.
* Experience with design systems or leading UI/UX decisions.
* A degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or other related field.



  





 Further, we believe that you
 


* Are a structured problem-solver, balancing user needs with technical pragmatism.
* Have a collaborative mindset - comfortable working with Cloud and Embedded teams.
* Are curious, adaptable, and motivated by seeing your work in real customer environments.
* Take ownership and enjoy autonomy - especially around UI and UX decisions.
* Are passionate about building high-quality, production-ready software.
* Are friendly, passionate, and purpose-driven teammate who brings positive energy and shared ambition to every challenge.

title: Engineering Manager till teamet för Operativa verktyg ombord
description:
**Om denna position** 




*Vill du leda ett utvecklingsteam och samtidigt bidra till ett mer hållbart resande? Vi söker en engagerad* 
***Engineering***
*Manager som vill utveckla nästa generations digitala lösningar som får SJ att rulla på riktigt. Hos oss kombinerar du teknik, ledarskap och samhällsnytta i en spännande och föränderlig bransch.* 




  





**Din kommande roll** 




 Som Engineering Manager leder du ett tvärfunktionellt team av utvecklare och teknikspecialister som utvecklar och underhåller våra system för operativa verktyg ombord. Våra användare arbetar dygnet runt, och deras arbetsverktyg bygger på Android-plattformen. Därför skapar vi lösningar som är kritiska för verksamheten och måste fungera utan avbrott.
 



  





 Vi utvecklar i
 **Kotlin** 
 för både front-end och back-end, och vår infrastruktur är byggd på
 **Microsoft Azure** 
 . Du får en central roll i att forma hur vi arbetar med molntjänster och mjukvaruarkitektur.
 



  





 Du kommer att:
 


* Säkerställa teamets leveransförmåga och att våra tekniska lösningar är robusta, framtidssäkra och verksamhetsnära.
* Leda, coacha och utveckla teamets medlemmar genom tydlig kommunikation och målstyrning.
* Arbeta tätt tillsammans med produktledning, design och verksamhet för att omsätta kundbehov till värdeskapande lösningar.
* Bidra till arkitekturval, tekniska beslut och strategisk utveckling av vår plattformsmiljö i Azure.
* Arbeta aktivt som en del av teamet med kontinuerliga förbättringar, säkerhet, kvalitet och teknisk skuld.



  





**Förväntningar på den vi söker** 




 Vi söker dig som har en teknisk bakgrund och trivs i rollen som ledare. Du förstår vikten av pålitliga system i en samhällskritisk verksamhet och drivs av att skapa struktur och riktning i en tekniskt komplex miljö.
 



  





 Vi ser gärna att du har:
 


* Erfarenhet av att leda mjukvaruteam med ansvar för leverans och medarbetare
* God förståelse för systemutveckling, moderna utvecklingsmetoder, DevOps och systemarkitektur.
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar – gärna Microsoft Azure.
* En bakgrund som utvecklare inom backend, gärna med kunskap i Java.
* Förmåga att skapa engagemang, tydlighet och samarbete i teamet.
* Akademisk utbildning på högskola/universitet eller motsvarande erfarenhet.



  





*Det är högt meriterande om du har erfarenhet av att utveckla Native applikationer för Android, gärna med kunskap inom Kotlin.* 




  





 Hos oss får du arbeta med teknik som gör skillnad – varje dag. Vi gör det för resenären som ska hem till någon och för kollegan som vill göra sitt jobb utan krångel. Välkommen att forma framtidens tågresa tillsammans med oss!
 



  





**Ansökan och information** 




 Urval sker löpande så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
 



  





**Om SJ AB** 




 SJ är ett svenskt reseföretag som erbjuder hållbara tågresor i egen regi och i samarbete med andra. SJ är ett av Sveriges grönaste varumärken och en del av lösningen för att klimatmålen ska nås. Koncernens drygt 6 600 medarbetare i Sverige och Norge bidrar alla till ökat tågresande – SJ för Sverige framåt.

title: Sr Software Engineer – Build the Future of Health with Apotea | Stockholm
description:
**Senior Software Engineer – Build the Future of Health with Apotea 🚀**
 At
 **Apotea** 
 , Sweden’s leading online pharmacy, we’re reshaping how healthcare reaches people — smarter, faster, and more sustainably. Every system we optimize and every line of code we write brings us closer to a society where better health is accessible for everyone.
   

  

 Now, we’re looking for a
 **Senior Software Engineer** 
 to take a leading role in developing and scaling the systems that power our entire operation — from seamless customer experiences to world-class logistics.
   

  

 This isn’t a role for someone who wants “just another dev job.” This is your chance to be part of a purpose-driven tech journey where your impact goes far beyond code.
   

  

**💡 Why this role matters**
 At Apotea, technology isn’t a support function — it’s our competitive edge. You’ll be joining the
 **core of Apoteas tech team** 
 , where uptime, performance, and innovation meet real-world impact. You’ll help us design and evolve the complex systems that keep millions of deliveries moving, pharmacies stocked, and customers cared for every single day.
   

  

 As a Senior Software Engineer, you’ll lead by doing — combining deep technical skill with curiosity, initiative, and collaboration.
   

  

**👩‍💻 What You’ll Do**
**Design, build, and evolve** 
 high-performance systems that keep Apotea running at scale.
   

  

**Lead technical direction** 
 within projects and mentor other developers through complex problem-solving.
   

  

**Drive innovation** 
 through automation, modernization, and new integrations — from logistics partners to sister companies.
   

  

**Collaborate across teams** 
 to bridge business needs and technical execution.
   

  

**Strengthen reliability and scalability** 
 across our .NET ecosystem — keeping millions of transactions flowing seamlessly.
   

  

**Shape the future** 
 of Apotea’s tech landscape — your ideas will influence how we grow.
   

  

**🧠 Who You Are**
 You’re an experienced engineer who loves tackling complexity and turning it into clarity. You thrive in fast-paced environments where real impact is visible every day. You’re both hands-on and strategic — equally comfortable writing elegant .NET code as you are leading architectural discussions.
   

  

**You’ll Fit Right In If You**
* Write clean, maintainable C#/.NET code with a focus on performance and scalability.
* Understand system architecture, distributed systems, and data flow in complex environments.
* Have strong problem-solving and debugging skills — you stay calm under pressure and focused on solutions.
* Enjoy mentoring, sharing knowledge, and lifting others around you.
* Communicate effectively across technical and non-technical teams.


**🌟 Extra kudos if you bring**
 Experience in
 **logistics, e-commerce, or ERP/WMS systems** 
 .
   

  

 Familiarity with
 **cloud infrastructure** 
 ,
 **DevOps** 
 , or automation tools.
   

  

 A background in
 **integration projects** 
 or migration work.
   

  

 Swedish language skills — a plus, not a must.
   

  

**What Apotea Offers You**
 ✨ A role where your code impacts millions of people.
   

  

 ✨ The chance to work in Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company.
   

  

 ✨ An agile, flat organization where ideas matter more than titles.
   

  

 ✨ Growth opportunities: training, mentorship, and conferences.
   

  

 ✨ A collaborative, transparent culture where your voice counts.
   

  

 ✨ A meaningful mission – making healthcare more accessible while caring for the planet.
   

  

**❤️ About Apotea**
 Apotea.se is Sweden’s largest online pharmacy, with the country’s broadest range of over 32,000 non-prescription items and over 19,000 prescription drugs for humans and animals. Recognized as Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company (Sustainable Brand Index 2021), we simplify everyday life for our customers with fast deliveries and expert advice. In 2024, Apotea reached a turnover of SEK 6.5 billion and currently employs about 1,000 people across Stockholm, Årsta, Lidingö, Morgongåva and Varberg.
   

  

 Follow us on social media to stay up to date on everything that's happening at Apotea
   

  

 LinkedIn
   

  

 Instagram
   

  

 Apotea is an inclusive employer that values diversity. We welcome all applicants and strive to create a work environment where people, regardless of background, gender, age, religion, or disability, can thrive and grow.
   

  

**Recruitment process**
* Apply
* Screening interview
* Technical interview
* Culture fit interview
* Background check (mandatory in pharmacy industry)
* Offer 🎉


 📍 Location: Sveavägen 168, Stockholm
   

  

 🏢 Work model: We work on-site
   

  

 👤 Reports to: Head of IT Operations
   

  

**Ready to join the journey?**
 Don’t wait – interviews happen continuously, and the role may be filled quickly. Apply today and be part of building something bigger than just software.
   

  

*Welcome to Apotea – where technology meets health, and your work creates real change.*
 Apotea är Sveriges största nätapotek med fokus på hållbarhet och snabba leveranser. Vår logistik är hjärtat i verksamheten, och vi har som mål att bli Nordens största apotek och Sveriges mest hållbara företag. Tillsammans med våra kunder har vi samlat in över 100 miljoner kronor till välgörenhet, och vi fortsätter att växa varje år – med våra medarbetare som den drivande kraften bakom framgången.

title: Senior Backend Engineer, Personalisation
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 Wolt’s
 **Personalization team** 
 is responsible for creating a tailored experience for Wolt’s customers across their shopping journey, helping them to discover the best restaurants, dishes or items that match their culinary and shopping preferences across multiple premises such as Discovery, In Venue or Checkout.
   

  

 We build and maintain the
 **recommendation systems** 
 that power these experiences in real time for millions of users across more than 30 markets. For example, the team is responsible for the models that rank restaurants in Wolt’s Discovery page, venues in Wolt’s category pages or items in Wolt’s in-venue and cart premises. It also personalises other components in Wolt’s shopping experience such as brands, banners or food categories that are relevant entry points for our customers to explore Wolt’s assortment.
   

  

 The team is multidisciplinary, including software engineers, applied scientists, ML Engineers. Together, we own the
 **ML-powered personalisation stack** 
 , integrations across Wolt’s platform, and the systems that turn customer behavior and data into meaningful, dynamic and engaging experiences.
   

  

 What you’ll be doing
   

  

 As a
 **Software Engineer** 
 in Wolt’s Personalisation team, you will:
   

  

* Design, build, and scale backend systems and APIs that deliver personalised experiences to millions of customers every day.
* Work closely with ML Engineers and Applied Scientists to integrate models into robust, high-performance services.
* Improve reliability and performance of the real-time recommendation stack, ensuring low-latency responses under high traffic.
* Contribute to the team’s technical architecture, driving improvements in scalability, observability, and developer experience.
* Champion code quality and engineering best practices and mentor junior team colleagues.
* Take ownership of the end-to-end software lifecycle — from design to deployment and monitoring — of the services you build.


 Our humble expectations
   

  

 Solid experience in
 **backend software development** 
 (the team uses Python & Go).A strong understanding of
 **distributed systems** 
 ,
 **microservice architectures** 
 , and
 **API design** 
 .Experience building
 **high-performance services** 
 — ideally at scale, with thousands of RPS and strict latency budgets.Familiarity with
 **containerisation and orchestration** 
 (Docker, Kubernetes) and
 **cloud-native development** 
 (AWS, GCP, or similar).Experience integrating with or supporting
 **ML or data-driven systems** 
 in production is a plus.Good understanding of
 **observability, monitoring** 
 , and debugging distributed systems.Experience collaborating in
 **cross-functional product teams** 
 , balancing technical quality with user impact.Strong communication and collaboration skills — you enjoy mentoring, pairing, and sharing knowledge.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

* The opportunity to shape Wolt’s personalisation systems, serving millions of customers daily.
* Be involved in rolling out new AI products for solving real customer problems with a measurable business impact.
* Work in a cross-disciplinary environment with ML Engineers, Applied Scientists, Data Scientists, Designers and Product Leads who share your passion for building great customer-facing products.
* A culture of ownership and excellence — you’ll take projects from conception to production and see the impact on users quickly at Woltwide.
* Have a tangible and measured impact on Wolt’s business KPIs and Wolt's customers’ experience.


 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Staff Data Engineer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.** 




  





 We’re looking for a Staff Data Engineer to help us evolve the data experience at Epidemic Sound. As a senior contributor reporting to a VP of Engineering, you'll be instrumental in shaping the future of our data landscape. We're currently on a journey to build a new data platform and shifting to a modern, event-based ingestion that integrates with our microservice architecture. This is a pivotal role where you'll have significant influence on our technical direction.
 



 You'll act as a key technical leader, providing strategic guidance and hands-on contributions while mentoring engineers across the company. You will work closely with other senior leaders to define our technical roadmap and ensure we're raising the bar on data quality and engineering practices.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Lead the design and evolution of our new data platform architecture.
* Act as a partner to stakeholders across the company, translating user needs into performant data solutions.
* Mentor and inspire engineers, promoting best practices in data modeling and system design.
* Champion data maturity across the entire organization, helping teams to take ownership of their data.



  





**What We're Looking For** 



* Deep experience in Data and Software Engineering, with a proven track record of leading complex technical projects.
* Experience with Event-Driven Architecture, BigQuery and DBT.
* Strong skills in system design and data architecture. Experience with GCP is a plus as our stack relies heavily on it.
* A strategic mindset with a focus on prioritizing impactful technical improvements over short-term gains.
* A passion for building a strong engineering culture, leading by example, and raising the bar on technical and data quality.
* The collaborative mindset and communication skills to excel in cross-functional environments, with a proven ability to informally lead and guide teams.



  





**Bonus if you have** 



* Experience with technologies like Snowplow, Looker, Go and Python.



  





**Equal opportunity employer** 




 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
 



  





**Application** 




 Ready to make the world feel your work? Apply now by clicking the link below! We embrace a hybrid model but love collaborating in person, so we spend the majority of our time in the office.
 



  





***Thinking about joining us? Tune in here - and see if we sound like your kind of vibe.***

title: AI Engineer
description:
**Job Description** 




 We generate 92 million tons of textile waste every year of which we are burning more than 90% because of our inability to repurpose and recycle them effectively.
 



 At Cyclothe, we are redesigning the textile waste management and are looking for an AI Engineer to join our team.
 



  





**About us:** 




 Founded in 2023 in Stockholm, Cyclothe develops
 **disruptive** 
 textile waste management technologies that champion a reuse-first approach and are built to meet the needs of a rapidly evolving circular economy.
 



 By creating tools that empower participation and enforce transparency across the value chain, we break the linear waste paradigm and accelerate the transition to a truly circular textile future.
 



 As we scale from pilots into production deployment, we are looking for an AI Engineer who will drive our intelligence layer: data, models, robotics, computer vision, edge-IoT and inference systems.
 



  





**Who are we looking for?** 




 We are redesigning the entire textile waste management ecosystem which starts with solving the problems of textile traceability, robotic sorting and effective redistribution.
 



  





 So, the primary responsibilities are to:
 


* Design, build and deploy machine learning / deep learning models for tasks like: textile material recognition, condition/quality scoring, multi-material detection, colour/fabric type classification, and robotics control.
* Work closely with hardware/robotics teams to integrate vision sensors (e.g., NIR, VIS, hyperspectral) and AI pipelines into automated sorting systems.
* Develop data-collection pipelines: ingesting imagery, sensor data, label workflows, annotation tools, synthetic data augmentation, continuous learning loops.
* Optimize edge/embedded inference (on-device, low latency) and/or cloud-based inference architectures for scalability across sorting units and deployment sites.
* Monitor, evaluate, and improve model performance (accuracy, throughput, robustness, drift detection) in real-world conditions, including dusty/wear-and-tear environments.
* Collaborate across product, operations, software/firmware and business teams: translate commercial requirements (e.g., “70% reduction in textile waste”, “20% cost reduction per ton pre-sorted”) into technical deliverables.



  





 Help build a data-driven backbone for traceability: linking each item drop, sensor readout, AI classification, and downstream reuse/recycle outcome in the Cyclothe platform.
 



  





**Skills & Requirements** 



* Strong experience (3-5+ years) building production-ready machine learning / deep learning systems, ideally in computer vision (image classification, segmentation), sensor fusion, embedded/edge deployment.
* Experience with Python + ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch), computer vision libraries (OpenCV, etc), model optimization for embedded/edge execution (e.g., ONNX, TensorRT).
* Good understanding of data pipelines: image/sensor acquisition, annotation, training/validation/test splitting, deployment monitoring.
* Comfort working in lean startup environments, able to wear multiple hats and iterate quickly.
* Fluent in English; Swedish and Turkish is a plus.



  





**Preferred (nice-to-haves):** 



* Familiarity with near-infrared (NIR) / VIS spectroscopy, material recognition in recycling/waste context.
* Experience integrating ML/AI in robotics or automated sorting systems (hardware + software).
* Experience with cloud services + edge inference (AWS, Azure, GCP + on-device).
* Passion for sustainability, circular economy, and impact-driven tech.



  





**Tech stack / environment you will influence & operate in** 




 You will have a key role in shaping Cyclothe’s intelligence stack. Today our environment includes:
 


* Multi-camera industrial vision (RGB, VIS, NIR, hyperspectral – expanding)
* NVIDIA edge inference (Jetson AGX Orin family) + industrial robotics
* On-device real-time decisioning (<150ms target latency)
* Cloud backbone (Azure) for DPP / traceability linkage



  





 This role is not just coding models — it is establishing our AI standard.
 



 Your architectural decisions now will define Cyclothe’s intelligence layer globally.
 



  





**One more thing: this is a foundational role** 




 Cyclothe’s AI sorting engine is the product.
 



 This is not a “service / feature” AI.
 



 This IS the core IP and will define all downstream reuse, repurpose and recycling economics.
 



 You will be the driving force behind:
 


* What is “quality” in post-consumer textile?
* How do we digitize the physical characteristics of clothing?
* How do we turn this into traceable, bankable, tradable data?



  





 This role reports directly to founder CTO and will hire/co-build a small AI engineering team around you within 6–12 months as we scale deployments.
 



  





**Why join us?** 



* Be part of a mission-driven deep-tech startup tackling one of the biggest waste problems in the world: textile waste.
* Work at the intersection of AI, robotics, IoT and circular economy — rare convergence.
* Early stage: big scope, high impact, you’ll shape the architecture, systems, and culture.
* Opportunity to scale across Europe and beyond (regulatory tailwinds, large markets).
* Collaborative culture: autonomy, flat structure, cross-discipline teamwork.



  





 If you’re interested, please apply and we will get back to you right away.

title: Senior iOS Engineer
description:
Flightradar24 is one of Stockholm’s most successful growth-stage tech companies, with over 5 million daily users across our mobile and web platforms. Our app is the world’s most popular flight tracking service, consistently ranking at the top of the App Store and Google Play charts. Alongside our consumer-facing products, we provide a wide range of commercial services trusted by leading airlines, airports, and aviation organizations worldwide.
   

  

 We are looking for a highly skilled senior iOS Engineer to join our mobile team in Stockholm. You’ll work hands-on at architectural scale - shaping our mobile architecture, guiding technical decisions, mentoring others, and building new features for millions of aviation enthusiasts. At Flightradar24, you’ll join a diverse, international team with over 30 nationalities represented, working together to push the boundaries of aviation data.
   

  

 Note that this position requires that you are able to work in Stockholm, Sweden. Relocation is not offered for this role.
   

  

 What you’ll do
   

  

* Build new features and improve existing ones in our iOS app - used by millions of users every day.
* Write clean, efficient, and testable Swift code using both UIKit and SwiftUI.
* Collaborate closely with iOS and Android engineers, designers, QAs, backend engineers and product owners to deliver high-quality experiences.
* Contribute to architecture discussions and help shape how we build scalable, maintainable mobile software.
* Continuously refactor and modernize our codebase, adopting the latest iOS technologies and best practices.
* Improve and maintain automated testing, ensuring releases are fast, stable, and reliable.
* Participate in code reviews, mentor engineers, and share knowledge across the team.
* Take part in app release coordination and ensure smooth deployments through CI/CD pipelines.


 Who you are
   

  

* Experienced iOS engineer (5–8 years) with a strong track record of shipping high-quality consumer apps.
* Proficient in Swift, with solid understanding of UIKit, SwiftUI, and modern concurrency (async/await).
* Strong grasp of software architecture patterns (MVVM, Clean Architecture, or similar).
* Passionate about writing clean, maintainable, and well-documented code.
* Comfortable with testing frameworks (XCTest, Snapshot tests) and CI/CD tools (Fastlane, Codemagic, GitHub Actions, Xcode Cloud).
* Curious, proactive, and eager to improve developer experience and overall app performance.
* Great communicator and collaborator who enjoys teamwork, feedback, and shared success.
* Bonus: experience with Firebase, MapKit, or StoreKit.


**About Flightradar24**
 With over 4 million daily users, Flightradar24 is the world’s most popular flight tracking service. Our app regularly tops the App Store and Google Play Travel charts. We also offer a wide range of commercial services and our customers include many of the biggest names in aviation.
   

  

 We're constantly adding new services and improving existing products. To help us meet those challenges, we're looking for creative, collaborative and tech-savvy applicants to join us.
   

  

 Benefits of working at Flightradar24 include:
   

  

* Opportunity to impact a service with millions of end users from all around the world
* Flexible and social work environment with free beverages, fruit, and snacks
* Modern office in the heart of beautiful downtown Stockholm, Sweden
* Being part of a diverse team with +30 nationalities and 6 continents represented with English being our main language


 Flightradar24 started as a hobby project in 2006 when two Swedish aviation geeks decided to build a network of ADS-B receivers in Northern and Central Europe. In 2009 we opened up the network, and made it possible for anyone with an ADS-B receiver to upload data to the network. Many parts of the world were quickly covered, but the quest to provide global ADS-B coverage is still ongoing.
   

  

**Flightradar24 at a glance**
* Largest ADS-B network in the world with over 50,000 connected receivers
* 5+ million users per day
* 100+ million app downloads

title: Sr. Technical Product Manager | AI & Cloud team
description:
**About The Role**
**Your mission:** 
 Lead a cross-functional team of engineers to rebuild Apotea’s tech stack in the cloud, starting with Supply Chain, the backbone of Apotea’s operations.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Define the product vision & strategy for Apotea’s cloud transformation; starting with Supply Chain, then expanding to future domains like logistics, customer experience, and fulfillment.
* Bridge business and technology, translating operational needs into clear technical requirements and prioritizing initiatives with measurable impact.
* Hire & lead the team that is rebuilding Apotea in the cloud and setting new standards for reliability, performance, and maintainability.
* Collaborate with engineering leadership to design and implement a scalable, secure, and future-ready cloud architecture.
* Develop the product roadmap and manage tradeoffs between speed, cost, and long-term scalability.
* Ensure cross-functional alignment with operations, logistics, and data teams to deliver end-to-end business value.
* Collaborate with AI teams to ensure the new cloud foundation supports future AI-driven products and automation.
* Establish success metrics for transformation progress, focusing on operational efficiency, scalability, uptime, and developer velocity.
* Communicate progress clearly and often to leadership and stakeholders, ensuring transparency and buy-in.
* Build and inspire a high-performing team culture that values experimentation, ownership, and technical excellence.


**Who You Are**
 We’re looking for a
 **technical and strategic product leader** 
 who thrives at the intersection of cloud infrastructure, business operations, and product innovation.
   

  

**You’re TECHNICAL Enough To Lead Transformation**
* Understands cloud technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP), APIs, microservices, and modern data platforms.
* Familiar with DevOps, CI/CD, and software architecture principles.
* Bonus: Experience migrating legacy systems to the cloud or modernizing enterprise systems.


**You’re a PRODUCT STRATEGIST Who**
* Turns complex business and technical challenges into a clear product roadmap.
* Prioritizes outcomes that deliver real operational and business value.
* Communicates clearly across technical and non-technical teams.


**You’re a LEADER Who**
* Builds trust and momentum across diverse teams.
* Motivates engineers through clear goals, autonomy, and impact.
* Balances hands-on involvement with strategic oversight.


**You’re a SYSTEM THINKER**
* Understands how supply chain, logistics, data, and automation connect.
* Can zoom out to align architecture and business strategy, then zoom in to make practical product tradeoffs.


**BONUS Points For Experience With**
* E-commerce, logistics, or supply chain systems.
* Cloud migrations or platform rebuilds at scale.
* AI or automation technologies.
* Swedish language skills (not required, but a plus).


**What Apotea Offers You**
* A defining role in one of Sweden’s largest cloud transformation projects in e-commerce.
* The chance to rebuild Apotea’s tech foundation for the next decade of growth.
* A high-impact position reporting to the Chief AI Officer.
* A collaborative, flat organization with minimal bureaucracy.
* A culture that values experimentation, ownership, and learning.
* Opportunities for professional growth and training.
* The satisfaction of contributing to a meaningful mission; making healthcare accessible, sustainable, and efficient.


**About Apotea**
 Apotea.se is Sweden’s largest online pharmacy, with the country’s broadest range of over 32,000 non-prescription items and nearly 19,000 prescription drugs for humans and animals. Recognized as Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company (Sustainable Brand Index 2021), we simplify everyday life for our customers with fast deliveries and expert advice. In 2024, Apotea reached a turnover of SEK 6.5 billion and currently employs about 1,000 people across Stockholm, Lidingö, and Morgongåva.
   

  

 LinkedIn
   

  

 Instagram
   

  

  

  

 Apotea is an inclusive employer that values diversity. We welcome all applicants and strive to create a work environment where people, regardless of background, gender, age, religion, or disability, can thrive and grow.
   

  

**Recruitment Process**
* Apply
* Interview: Screening
* Interview: Technical & Product Capabilities
* Interview: Culture Fit
* Background Check: As a pharmacy, we always conduct a background check.
* Offer Presented


****Location** 
 :** 
 Sveavägen 168, Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

****Reports to****
**:** 
 Chief AI Officer
   

  

**Application**
 Do not hesitate to send in your application already today. For more information or questions, visit our career page or contact us at jobb@apotea.se. We do not accept applications via email.
   

  

***Join Us and Make a Difference -** 
**We hope you want to be a part of our team!***
*Submit your application today—interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis, and the position may be filled immediately. Start date by agreement.
   

  

*Welcome to Apotea – where technology meets health and creates magic!**
 Apotea är Sveriges största nätapotek med fokus på hållbarhet och snabba leveranser. Vår logistik är hjärtat i verksamheten, och vi har som mål att bli Nordens största apotek och Sveriges mest hållbara företag. Tillsammans med våra kunder har vi samlat in över 100 miljoner kronor till välgörenhet, och vi fortsätter att växa varje år – med våra medarbetare som den drivande kraften bakom framgången.

title: Backend Engineer - Subscriptions
description:
We are a team working on defining the premium and free value propositions, and are seeking a Backend Engineer to join us.
   

  

 We own a system to define the product features that all our free, mid-tier and premium products have. We are the central source of truth for all existing and new premium products and own datasets and APls that teams around us can use. We are working on new systems to control pricing and discount availability for our premium products. Besides this we also own a system for capping features (e.g. audiobook consumption, on-demand playback, and more).
   

  

 We are a mature team and we have a good mix of investigation and implementation work and a lot of opportunities to lead initiatives of all sorts of sizes and complexity. We are very fast-paced and have a culture of helping teams that we work with with what they need.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Build and deliver end-to-end backend solutions for our core systems, taking responsibility for the quality and maintainability of your code.
* Lead the implementation of well-defined projects within the squad, coordinating with other engineers to ensure the team successfully meets its goals.
* Contribute to the evolution of our squad's architecture by proposing and implementing improvements to our existing systems.
* Work with product managers and stakeholders to translate requirements into robust and scalable technical solutions.
* Take an active role in the operational health of our systems, including facilitating incident response and improving observability.
* Improve our team's engineering practices through thoughtful code reviews, clear documentation, and mentoring other engineers.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have a strong professional experience building and maintaining scalable backend services.
* You have a strong command of Java and experience with container orchestration using Kubernetes.
* You are proficient with cloud platforms (GCP preferred) and have hands-on experience with data systems like BigQuery and data processing pipelines (e.g., using Scio or similar frameworks).
* You are a dependable engineer who thrives on taking complex, multi-part projects from concept to completion with a high degree of autonomy.
* You are a strong collaborator who can effectively coordinate with peers to deliver on squad-level initiatives.
* You look beyond the ticket, understanding the business context of your work and making pragmatic technical decisions to match.
* You enjoy sharing your knowledge and find it rewarding to help other engineers on your team grow their skills.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London or Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description:
At Scania Industrial Batteries, we design and build advanced battery systems for off-road machines - and the digital ecosystem that connects them. From our R&D hub in 
 **Solna, Sweden** 
 , and production site in 
 **Gdańsk, Poland** 
 , we create cloud platforms and data services that turn battery and machine data into real-time insight, automation, and performance. Our technology powers the electrification of heavy industries such as mining, construction, and marine - transforming how energy is used in some of the world’s toughest environments.
 



  





 We are looking for a 
 **Senior Embedded Software Engineer** 
 to join our Battery Management Systems (BMS)
 



 team.
 



  





 In this role, you’ll design, develop, and maintain embedded software solutions that power our products. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration between hardware and software, always with reliability, performance, and safety in mind. Your daily work will involve designing and implementing embedded software in C with a strong focus on MISRA C standards, while developing for both real-time operating systems and bare-metal environments. Debugging is part of the role as well, where you’ll use tools such as Lauterbach and Segger to troubleshoot and optimize.
 



 You will be working with communication protocols like CAN and Ethernet, and with ensuring compliance with safety standards such as ISO 13849. Further, you’ll be working in requirements management tools such as Polarion, and drive efficient CI/CD pipelines through Git-based workflows.
 



  





**Skills & Requirements** 




 We are looking for someone with
 


* A degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or other related field.
* Solid understanding of C programming for embedded systems.
* Some hands-on experience with RTOS or bare-metal development.
* Comfort working with or learning to interpret hardware schematics.
* Familiarity with debugging tools (e.g., Lauterbach, Segger).
* Basic knowledge of communication protocols such as CAN or Ethernet.
* Experience using Git-based workflows and CI/CD pipelines.
* Strong communication skills in English, both written and spoken.



  





 It's an advantage if you have
 


* Experience with MISRA C or other safety-focused coding standards.
* Familiarity with requirements management tools such as Polarion.
* Exposure to functional safety standards (e.g., ISO 13849).



  





 Further, we believe that you are a
 


* Curious and motivated engineer who enjoys solving technical challenges.
* Detail-oriented developer who takes pride in writing reliable and maintainable code.
* Collaborative team player who enjoys learning from others and sharing your insights.
* Flexible and adaptable individual who thrives in a dynamic environment.
* Proactive learner with a genuine interest in embedded software and continuous improvement.
* Friendly, passionate, and purpose-driven person who brings positive energy and shared ambition to every challenge.

title: Power Platform Specialist
description:
**Vad erbjuder vi?**
* Möjlighet att arbeta i framkanten av Microsoft-teknik
* En central roll där din expertis inom Power Platform möjliggör innovativa lösningar och stärker våra Citizen Developers
* Nära samarbete mellan de nordiska länderna
* Ett högt medarbetarengagemang
* Kollektivavtal, tjänstepension enligt ITP planen och trygghetsförsäkringar
* Reseförmåner


 ”Vi är en arbetsplats med ett stort kunnande och en stark drivkraft att ständigt förbättra vår verksamhet. Som en del av Nordic Leisure Travel Group erbjuder vi en spännande och utvecklande miljö med möjlighet till en intern karriär. Vår arbetsglädje och vårt höga engagemang visar sig i vår årliga medarbetarundersökning – och vi är stolta över att vara en arbetsplats där du kan växa och utvecklas.”
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
* Högskoleutbildning inom datavetenskap, teknik, matematik eller motsvarande kunskap genom arbetslivserfarenhet
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av Microsoft Power Platform, inklusive Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI & Copilot Studio
* Praktisk tillämpning av Generativ AI
* Utmärkta problemlösnings- och analytiska färdigheter
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska


**Det är meriterande om du även:**
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta i en DevOps-kultur och med verktyg som AzureDevOps och GitHub
* Är certifierad inom AI & Microsoft Power Platform
* Har praktisk erfarenhet av att skapa AI Assistenter


 Ditt arbetssätt präglas av nyfikenhet och en vilja att ständigt utvecklas. Du motiveras av att lära dig nya saker och ser förändring som en möjlighet snarare än ett hinder. Vi värdesätter samarbete och söker en person som trivs i en teamorienterad miljö. Du är prestigelös, lyhörd och engagerad i att hitta gemensamma lösningar tillsammans med dina kollegor. Att ta ansvar är en självklarhet för dig, även när oväntade situationer uppstår. Du ser utmaningar som en naturlig del av arbetet och hanterar dem med ett positivt och lösningsfokuserat förhållningssätt.
   

  

**Vad innebär rollen?**
* Utforma, utveckla och tillhandahålla lösningar i Microsoft Power Platform & Copilot Studio
* Samarbeta med verksamheten och andra intressenter för att förstå affärskrav och identifiera möjligheter för AI-lösningar
* Utveckla och underhålla Power Platform-infrastruktur och verktyg inklusive AI-komponenter
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste utvecklingarna inom Microsoft Power Platform
* Utbilda och stötta Citizen Developers i organisationen
* Kommunicera komplexa tekniska koncept till icke-tekniska intressenter.


 Som Power Platform Specialist kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att utforma, utveckla och driftsätta lösningar i Microsoft Power Platform för att möta verksamhetens behov. Du kommer att ansvara för att driva plattformen framåt och att fungera som en möjliggörare för Citizen Developers inom vår organisation för low-code lösningar. Dessutom kommer du att arbeta i framkanten av teknologin genom att integrera Generativ AI och AI-assistenter för att automatisera processer och skapa nya värden för verksamheten.
   

  

 Du kommer att ingå i Vings Workplace team som ansvarar för att leverera innovativa och effektiva lösningar som driver vår verksamhet framåt. Teamet strävar efter att ständigt förbättras, och du kommer att ges stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling och att vara i framkant av den snabbt utvecklande low-code & AI teknologin.
   

  

****Intresserad?****
 Skicka in ansökan snarast då urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av tester från Alva Labs, ett logiskt problemlösningstest och ett personlighetstest. Vi genomför även bakgrundskontroll som sammanställer tidigare offentligt brottsregister och ekonomisk skuldupplysning.
   

  

 Rekryteringen görs i samarbete med 2Complete.
   

  

 Ving ingår i den nordiska resekoncernen Nordic Leisure Travel Group. I gruppen ingår researrangörerna Ving Sverige, Globetrotter, Ving Norge, Spies i Danmark, Tjäreborg i Finland, flygbolaget Sunclass Airlines samt våra egna hotellkoncept Sunwing Family Resorts, Ocean Beach Club och Sunprime Hotels. Gruppen säljer ett normalt år runt 1 250 000 resor i de nordiska länderna.
   

  

 Vi är ett företag där vi har roligt och bryr oss om varandra med vårt people promise "it should be fun, developing and rewarding doing a good job".
   

  

 Arbetsområde
   

  

 IT
   

  

 Roll: Technology Services
   

  

 Platser: Stockholm
   

  

 Distansarbete: Hybridarbete
   

  

 Anställningsform: Heltid
   

  

 Startdatum
   

  

 Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Kontaktperson: Elida Rhodin, elida.rhodin@2complete.se, +46 70 744 33 63 Skicka ansökan

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Om Azets** 




 Azets är en internationell koncern som erbjuder tjänster och rådgivning inom lön, ekonomi och HR. I Sverige har bolaget cirka 800 medarbetare och en omsättning på omkring 1 miljard SEK, och med totalt 9000 medarbetare inom koncernen.
 



  





 Vi söker nu en Data Engineer som vill vara med och bygga upp en modern dataplattform från grunden som ska bli deras motor för analys, automation och AI.
 



  





 Hos Azets får du stort inflytande och möjlighet att arbeta nära både ledning och nyckelfunktioner i ett miljardbolag under förändring. Det här är en roll för dig som vill växa i takt med ett område som får allt större strategisk betydelse och som vill vara med och forma hur data används i hela verksamheten.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Data Engineer hos Azets ansvarar du för att bygga och vidareutveckla deras dataplattform så att data är tillgänglig, strukturerad och användbar för analys, automation och AI. Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med kollegor inom Product, Automation & AI, Service Delivery och Commercial för att omvandla manuella processer till smarta, AI-drivna lösningar som skapar reellt värde i verksamheten.
 



  





**Du kommer bland annat att:** 



* Utveckla och underhålla data pipelines (ETL/ELT).
* Designa och förvalta datamodeller och arkitektur för analytics och AI/ML.
* Strukturera, normalisera och förbereda data från BPO och Audit.
* Säkerställa datakvalitet, dokumentation och spårbarhet.
* Samarbeta tvärfunktionellt för att driva datadrivna initiativ och lösningar.



  





**Om dig** 




 Du har några års erfarenhet av data engineering, är nyfiken och strukturerad, och lockas av utmaningen att komma in i en större organisation där AI och automation står i fokus. Din insats kommer göra skillnad, med ambitionen att ta BPO-affären till en helt ny nivå genom smarta lösningar och innovation. Du kommer in tidigt i ett växande team som får ansvar för en förändringsresa och för att bygga upp allt från pipeline till färdig produkt.
 



  





**Vi tror att du har:** 



* Erfarenhet av data engineering, ETL/ELT och datamodellering (dbt).
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Python och SQL.
* Erfarenhet av AWS, Azure eller GCP.
* Grundläggande förståelse för AI/ML.
* Relevant akademisk utbildning inom exempelvis datateknik, systemvetenskap eller liknande.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.



  





*Azets samarbetar med Safemind för denna rekrytering.*

title: Senior Rendering Engineer
description:
Come join the Frostbite Rendering team to work directly on the Render Hardware Abstraction Layer of the Frostbite engine. We develop the rendering backends for current and future platforms. The team is currently split between Stockholm, Orlando & Vancouver. We work closely with our "customers", Rendering Engineers, to ensure consistent performance and quality across our supported platforms. We hope you will join our team to push the rendering technology that drives the Frostbite Renderer forward and contribute to the success of some of the industry’s biggest titles.
 



  





**This is a hybrid working role and you will be required to live within a commutable distance to our Stockholm office. You will need to attend the office 3 days per week.** 




  





**Responsibilities** 




  




* Develop and maintain cross-platform graphics hardware abstraction layer for the Frostbite Engine.
* Develop and maintain tools to ensure high quality experience for render engineers using Frostbite.
* Work closely with game team engineers and the Frostbite rendering team to enable and deliver new rendering features.
* Define and drive low level performance profiling and optimization initiatives on multiple platforms.



  





  





**Qualifications** 




  




* Strong C++ knowledge with at least 7 years of professional programming experience in real-time rendering
* Experience working in rendering for multiple shipped titles on current-generation consoles (PS5, XBSX, PC)
* Knowledgeable of modern cpu/gpu hardware architecture
* Significant experience using a low-level graphics API (DX12, Vulkan, console, etc)
* Significant experience with Graphics Debugging Tools (Pix, Renderdoc, console, etc)
* Deep understanding of memory management and multi-threading with related debugging and optimization experience

title: Tech lead digital Innovation - skala AI
description:
Vill du omsätta idéer till prototyper och vara med och driva digital innovation som gör skillnad för Sveriges energiförsörjning? Svenska kraftnät är en nyckelaktör i energiomställningen. Vår IT-division växer för att möjliggöra en fördubblad elproduktion och en fossilfri framtid. Med ny teknik ökar vi både infrastrukturens kapacitet och utvecklingstakten inom digitalisering och processer.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en tech lead till vårt innovationslabb som kommer bidra till att höja innovationstakten och snabbt testa nya tekniska lösningar.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 I rollen leder du arbetet från problemidentifiering till färdig prototyp. Du arbetar nära verksamheten för att förstå behov, skapa lösningshypoteser och verifiera dem genom prototyputveckling. Mycket av arbetet sker i teknikens framkant och med AI som central komponent - både som utvecklingsverktyg och del av lösningen.
   

  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter**
* Leda workshops för att identifiera problem och möjligheter tillsammans med verksamheten.
* Ta fram lösningshypoteser och utveckla prototyper, exempelvis med agentbaserad utveckling eller prototyptjänster.
* Experimentera med och använda AI i utvecklingsprojekt.
* Effektivisera och automatisera utvecklingsprocesser.
* Presentera resultat och inspirera till fortsatt utveckling.


 Du kommer att få möjlighet att delta i kurser, workshops och konferenser för att hålla dig uppdaterad inom de senaste teknikerna och trenderna inom AI och digital innovation. Du kommer också att kunna utvecklas inom framtidens energiteknik hos den centrala spelaren i Sverige för energiomställningen.
   

  

**Om dig**
**Skallkrav**
 Vi söker dig som har god samarbetsförmåga och tycker om att skapa resultat tillsammans med kollegor. För att trivas i rollen ser vi att du är lösningsorienterad och lägger vikt vid att hålla dig informerad och lära nytt inom ditt yrkesområde. Som person är du organiserad och bra på att planera och slutföra det som påbörjas. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Du har en akademisk examen från högskola eller universitet, alternativt motsvarande kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt. Du har även:
   

  

* God programmeringskunskap (flerårig aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet som systemutvecklare).
* Erfarenhet av att använda AI både i egen utveckling och som del av en teknisk lösning.
* Erfarenhet från start-up, innovationsavdelning eller motsvarande innovativa miljöer.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


 Vi ser det som
 **meriterande** 
 om du har:
   

  

* Kunskap inom Design Thinking eller motsvarande användar- och problemorienterat angreppssätt.
* Erfarenhet av affärs- eller verksamhetsutveckling.
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom säkerhetskänslig verksamhet.


 Bra att veta
   

  

* Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm / Sundbyberg.
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %
* Sista ansökningsdag är den 17 november 2025. Vi använder urvalsfrågor istället för personligt brev.
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning.
* I denna rekryteringsprocess tillämpas tester för slutkandidat/er.
* Förmåner | Svenska kraftnät


 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Experis. Vid frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta rekryteringskonsult Carina Eyoma, carina.eyoma@se.experis.com, 073 086 22 75. Vid frågor om tjänsten kontakta gärna rekryterande chef Daniel Hellqvist, 072-590 24 00. Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72 och Erica Midfjäll ST, 010 475 87 31. Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se
   

  

 Jobba här - bli en viktig del av vår energiframtid | Svenska kraftnät
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare i samband med rekrytering, vi har upphandlade avtal som gäller för Svenska kraftnät som statlig myndighet.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning.
   

  

 För anställning på Svenska kraftnät kan det vara ett krav på svenskt medborgarskap i vissa befattningar. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.
   

  

 För mer information om säkerhetsprövning
   

  

 Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar.
   

  

 Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss:
   

  

 Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät

title: Gameplay Engineer - Dynamism
description:
As a Gameplay Engineer in the Dynamism Team at Embark, you will work on the cutting edge destruction technology utilized in THE FINALS, alongside some of the most talented people in the games industry.
   

  

 We believe that great games are made in creative environments, where builds are always playable, and teams can move fast and test as many ideas as possible. In close collaboration with our designers, you will develop new and exciting gameplay features tied to dynamic elements such as destruction, fire, and water, while also creating tools that enable designers to craft the most dynamic levels seen in a first person shooter.
   

  

 The games we're making are built in Unreal, using C++, blueprints and a scripting language called Angelscript.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Collaborate with a wide range of talents at Embark to deliver ground-breaking technical solutions to create fun and dynamic gameplay for our players
* Prototype, experiment, and iterate on gameplay features tied to destruction & dynamism
* Enable our maps team to build the most dynamic levels ever seen in a first person shooter by providing tools for authoring destruction & dynamism


**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind, eager to tackle challenging problems
* Comfortable navigating and debugging complex systems
* A strong background in C++
* A good grasp of what good gameplay looks and feels like
* An interest in computer science and programming as a craft
* Fluent in English - our team comes from all over the world!


**Additionally one or some of these would be a great bonus**
* Experience with multiplayer game development
* Experience with game physics, such as destruction & dynamism
* Previously worked with shooter games
* Game-oriented mindset, always looking for ways to improve gameplay


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Software Engineer - AI Developer Workflows
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

**Frostbite** 
 is EA's proprietary game engine. Its versatile technology power creation on some of the world's most iconic and visually stunning games, including titles from EA Sports and Battlefield. Frostbite provides a unified platform that empowers developers to create hyper-realistic worlds, intricate gameplay, and lifelike animations with unmatched speed and quality.
   

  

**The Role**
 As
 **Software Engineer** 
 at Frostbite, reporting to a Manager of Engine Development, you will contribute to Frostbite's goals of transforming software engineering and quality processes with the power of generative AI, agents and context engineering. You will collaborate with other engineers and technical leaders, and you will roll out solutions to hundreds of engine and game developers, resulting in better games.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* You will develop AI-based foundations and services that allow the Frostbite community to benefit from agentic developer workflows.
* You will provide secure and scalable solutions for all stages of the software development lifecycle, including spec-driven coding, validation and releasing.
* You will pilot new AI capabilities to assess their impact on developer efficiency and quality.


**Qualifications**
* 4+ years of job experience in a hands-on coding role using languages like Python, C# or C++.
* 1+ years of experience using generative AI software engineering solutions such as GitHub CoPilot.
* Proficiency in good development practices (version control, code reviews) and validation (static code analysis, unit testing, CI/CD pipelines).


**Bonus but not mandatory**
* Experience with ML, GenAI and LLM concepts and technologies like knowledge graphs, vector databases, context engineering, MCP, LangChain, or RAG.
* Experience with observability of large data-driven services.
* Experience cloud infrastructure providers like Azure.
* Familiarity with game development processes.


 This is a hybrid remote/in-office role.
   

  

**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: Senior utvecklare
description:
**Om rollen** 




 Vi söker en senior utvecklare, en skicklig och driven fullstackutvecklare som vill vara en del av ett team där kvalitet, samarbete och teknisk innovation står i fokus.
 



 Som senior systemutvecklare hos oss blir du en nyckelspelare i vårt utvecklingsteam som ansvarar för arkitektur, tekniska val och implementation av våra digitala plattformar. Vi arbetar i Microsoftstacken och bygger moderna webb- och mobilapplikationer i Azure-miljö med Umbraco CMS. Tillsammans med teamet utvecklare ansvarar du för att säkerställa kodkvalitet och bidra till en effektiv utvecklingsprocess.
 



  





**Profil** 




 Vi söker dig som är nyfiken, noggrann, kommunikativ och trivs med att arbeta i team. Du brinner för kodning och ser värdet i att samarbeta för att nå gemensamma mål. Du har en förmåga att arbeta proaktivt, se helheten och driva utvecklingen framåt.
 



 Du har en god förmåga att kommunicera och samarbeta med dina kollegor samt att dela kunskap och bidra till en öppen och lärande kultur.
 



 Du uppskattar att samarbeta med både utvecklare, designer och driftteam för att skapa effektiva, tillgängliga och hållbara lösningar.
 



  





**Erfarenheter och kvalifikationer** 



* Längre erfarenhet av publik webb med höga krav på tillgänglighet, säkerhet och prestanda.
* Längre erfarenhet av att analysera, designa, utveckla, implementera och underhålla ekosystem av skalbara tjänster i Azure
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med ett CMS
* Minst 7 års erfarenhet som fullstackutvecklare C#, .NET, JavaScript/TypeScript. Arbetat med en eller flera databaser/ORM; Azure SQL, SQL server, Entity framwork, MongoDB, Redis. Frontend och ramverk; HTML5, responsiv/adaptiv design, CSS3, arbetat med en eller flera ramverk; React, NodeJS, NextJS samt erfarenhet av DevOps, CI/CD
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila team och metoder som SCRUM eller Kanban
* Relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift, goda kunskaper engelska
* Stark lagspelare som bidrar till teamets framgång



  





**Meriterande erfarenheter** 



* Umbraco (CMS)
* Arbetat med Siteimprove eller annat verktyg för att mäta tillgänglighet
* Azure DevOps och infrastruktur som kod
* Erfarenhet av utveckling av mobilappar
* Erfarenhet av Azure AI Search och Azure Open AI
* Intresse för utveckling av AI tjänster



  





**Vår tekniska miljö** 




 Vi har en publik webb med ca 1 miljon unika besökare per år med Umbraco som CMS.
 



 Kärnan i för våra tjänster är generellt Microsoft Azure för webb, backend, identitet (Entra kompletterat med Identity server), lagring, AI (AI Search, OpenAI) och BI (Synapse, Databricks, Power BI), Integration (logikappar och Synapse). För mobil har vi app på Apple store och Google play.
 



 Vi jobbar i Azure Devops för samarbete med verksamhet, projekt och för CI/CD, XCode Cloud för Apple, generellt har vi infrastruktur som kod.
 



 Vi jobbar generellt med moderna tekniker och ramverk, primärt .NET Core, C#, Node.js, JavaScript, Asure SQL och SQL server, React, Next.js och verktyg i som VS Code, Git, GitHub Copilot, Figma.
 



  





**Varför välja oss?** 




 Tjänsten är en heltidstjänst och placerad på Lernias huvudkontor vid Hötorget i Stockholm. Vi ser ett stort värde i att ses och arbeta tillsammans på kontoren och förväntar oss att alla arbetar 2-3 dagar i veckan på kontoret. Det är möjligt med distansarbete när det passar med teamet/arbetet.
 



 Vi erbjuder dig ett stimulerande jobb på en arbetsplats där IT jobbar i nära samarbete med verksamheten. Vi har bra stöd för vårt agila arbetssätt. Vi har roligt, bryr oss om varandra och är engagerade i vårt arbete.
 



 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en bakgrundskontroll att genomföras.
 



  





 För att säkerställa en rättvis och objektiv rekryteringsprocess använder vi oss av tester. Testerna hjälper oss att bedöma potential och matchning utifrån både personlighet och problemlösningsförmåga.
 



  





**Om Lernia** 




 Du som arbetar hos oss på Lernia är med och stärker Sveriges konkurrenskraft. Genom våra insatser inom utbildning, matchning, bemanning och rekrytering ser vi till att företag får den kompetens de behöver och att tiotusentals människor kommer i arbete. Det ger oss mening i vårt jobb och gör oss stolta. Här får du själv utvecklas samtidigt som du ser andra växa genom sina nästa steg i arbetslivet. Hos oss får du ett sammanhang att trivas och utvecklas i. Vi är alla lika och unika och alla behövs. Det tror vi starkt på och det verkar vi för – tillsammans
 



  





**Hur du söker tjänsten** 




 För att söka tjänsten, scrolla ner till ansökningsformuläret nedan. Om du har några frågor eller funderingar, vänligen kontakta Alice Nerö via e-post: alice.nero@lernia.se. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag!

title: Senior Android Engineer
description:
Flightradar24 is one of Stockholm’s most successful growth-stage tech companies, with over 5 million daily users across our mobile and web platforms. Our app is the world’s most popular flight tracking service, consistently ranking at the top of the App Store and Google Play charts. Alongside our consumer-facing products, we provide a wide range of commercial services trusted by leading airlines, airports, and aviation organizations worldwide.
   

  

 We are looking for a highly skilled senior Android Engineer to join our mobile team in Stockholm. You’ll work hands-on at architectural scale - shaping our mobile architecture, guiding technical decisions, mentoring others, and building new features for millions of aviation enthusiasts.
